{{EngvarB|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Julián Speroni | image = Speroni.jpg | image_size = | caption = Speroni warming-up with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in 2015 | fullname = Julián Maria Speroni<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1979|5|18|df=y}}<ref name="Hugman2010-11">{{cite book | editor-first = Barry J. | editor-last = Hugman | title = The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 | year = 2010 | publisher = Mainstream Publishing | location = Edinburgh | isbn = 978-1-84596-601-0 | page = 389 }}</ref> | birth_place = [[Buenos Aires]], Argentina | height = 1.86 m<ref>{{cite web|title=Julián Speroni profile|url=http://www.cpfc.co.uk/team/player-profile|publisher =CPFC.co.uk}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1= 1997–1999 | youthclubs1= [[Club Atlético Platense|Platense]] | years1 = 1999–2001 | clubs1 = [[Club Atlético Platense|Platense]] | caps1 = 2 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2001–2004 | clubs2 = [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] | caps2 = 92 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2004– | clubs3 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps3 = 371 | goals3 = 0 | club-update = 17:45, 19 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 1998 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalteam-update = 16 March 2013 }} '''Julián Maria Speroni''' ({{IPA-es|xuˈljan espeˈɾoni}}; born 18 May 1979) is an Argentine [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for English club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].
Having begun his career at [[Club Atlético Platense|Platense]], he played three seasons in the [[Scottish Premier League]] with [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] before joining Crystal Palace for £750,000 in 2004. He has played 400 matches across all competitions for his current club.
==Club career== ===Dundee=== Speroni was born in [[Buenos Aires]].<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> He started his career with [[Club Atlético Platense]], in his homeland, but moved after just one year as a professional and two matches,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.revistaeldiego.net/2012/12/julian-speroni-conquistador-silencioso.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-10-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20141029131030/http://www.revistaeldiego.net/2012/12/julian-speroni-conquistador-silencioso.html |archivedate=29 October 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> to [[Scotland|Scottish]] side [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]]. Dundee manager [[Ivano Bonetti]] received advice from an Italian contact to Speroni's potential. The move to Dundee was delayed for two months, due to administration delays in Argentina, holding up Speroni's application for an Italian passport.<ref name="Interview with Speroni 2002">[http://www.thefreelibrary.com/Football%3A+I+OWE+EVERYTHING+TO+IVANO.-a0102435273 Interview with Speroni 2002]</ref>
===Crystal Palace===
He signed for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], newly promoted to the [[Premier League]], on 13 July 2004, for a fee of around £750,000.<ref>{{cite news|title=Speroni joins Palace|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/crystal_palace/3811683.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 July 2004|accessdate=18 April 2015}}</ref> Speroni made his debut for Palace against Everton in a three goals to one defeat. Speroni only started the first six games for his newly promoted team in their Premier League campaign, before he was replaced by Hungarian international [[Gábor Király]].{{citation needed|date=November 2017}}
His first three seasons at [[Selhurst Park]] saw him largely play understudy to Király who made the goalkeeping spot his own. This was until the Hungarian departed Selhurst Park at the end of the 2006–07 season. Back in the line-up Speroni flourished and won his reputation back.{{citation needed|date=November 2017}} Palace managed to reach the play-offs with Speroni earning a new three-year contract at the end of the 2007–08 season and the club's "[[Crystal Palace F.C. Player of the Year|Player of the Year]]" award. At the end of the following season, he retained Palace's "Player of the Year" award.
In the 2009–10 season, Speroni again drew praise. Like at Dundee, his club fell into financial difficulty, and finished the season in administration. This meant a ten-point deduction, and survival was only secured on the final day of the season. For his role in this, Speroni was given a new record, becoming the first man to win Palace's "Player of the Year" award for three consecutive years. Then on 10 December 2010, Speroni agreed a 3 1⁄2 year extension to his current contract.<ref>{{cite news|title=Speroni commits to Palace|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/6565971/speroni-commits-to-palace|publisher=Sky Sports|date=10 December 2010|accessdate=18 April 2015}}</ref>
At the end of the 2013–14 season, Speroni was named Player of the Year for the fourth time.<ref name="POTY">{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/may/speroni-lands-fourth-player-of-the-year-award/|title=Speroni Lands Fourth Player of the Year Award|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.|date=6 May 2014|accessdate=18 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150418225344/https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/may/speroni-lands-fourth-player-of-the-year-award/|archivedate=18 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> His contract expired early into 2014 and he subsequently negotiated contract offers with Crystal Palace, Sunderland and West Brom.<ref>{{cite web|title=Premier League clubs submit retained and released lists |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/may/premier-league-clubs-submit-retained-and-released-lists.html |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=23 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150504185633/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/may/premier-league-clubs-submit-retained-and-released-lists.html |archivedate= 4 May 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Julian Speroni could leave Crystal Palace|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/466697/Julian-Speroni-could-leave-Crystal-Palace|publisher=Daily Express|date=25 March 2014|accessdate=18 April 2015}}</ref> On 13 June 2014 Crystal Palace announced that Speroni had signed a new contract with the club for 12 months with a further 12 month option. Speroni is much loved by the Crystal Palace fans and has become a cult hero at the club being named the supporters' player of the season on four separate occasions.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/june/speroni-signs-new-contract/|title=Speroni Signs New Contract|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.|date=13 June 2014|accessdate=18 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150418224142/https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/june/speroni-signs-new-contract/|archivedate=18 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Speroni was rewarded for his years of service to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] with a Testimonial match against [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] on 26 May 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dundeefc.co.uk/news/dundee-to-play-in-speroni-testimonial|title=DUNDEE TO PLAY IN SPERONI TESTIMONIAL|publisher=Dundee F.C.|date=20 January 2015|accessdate=18 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150418223255/http://www.dundeefc.co.uk/news/dundee-to-play-in-speroni-testimonial|archivedate=18 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> Speroni made his 347th league appearance for the club, breaking [[John Jackson (footballer, born 1942)|John Jackson]]'s record as the team's goalkeeper with the most league appearances, against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 21 February 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/february/speroni-breaks-league-record/|title=Speroni Breaks League Record|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.|date=25 February 2015|accessdate=18 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150418224724/https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/february/speroni-breaks-league-record/|archivedate=18 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref>
In March 2015, prior to the testimonial, Speroni was inducted into the [[Dundee F.C.#Hall of Fame|Dundee Hall of Fame]] picking up the International Award which was previously won by fellow countryman [[Claudio Caniggia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dundeefc.co.uk/news/the-2015-dundee-fc-hall-of-fame-2|title=2015 Dundee FC Hall of Fame 2|publisher=Dundee F.C.|date=28 March 2015|accessdate=18 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150418223911/http://www.dundeefc.co.uk/news/the-2015-dundee-fc-hall-of-fame-2|archivedate=18 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref>
On 22 May 2015, Speroni signed a one-year contract extension at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] to keep him at the club until at least the end of the [[2015-16 Premier League|2015–16 season]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Speroni Extends Eagles Stay|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/may/speroni-extends-eagles-stay/|publisher=Crystal Palace|accessdate=8 July 2015|date=22 May 2015}}</ref> He was dropped to third-choice goalkeeper in that season, behind [[Wayne Hennessey]] and [[Alex McCarthy]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Alan Pardew reveals why he dropped this Crystal Palace ace|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/500256/Alan-Pardew-Crystal-Palace-FA-Cup-Julian-Speroni-Premier-League-fans-right-to-criticise|publisher=Daily Star|accessdate=15 September 2016|date=10 March 2016}}</ref> but still played 2 league games, including the league match against [[Southampton F.C.]] in the final day of the season, when he equaled [[John Jackson (footballer, born 1942)|John Jackson]]’s club appearance record as a goalkeeper in all competitions.<ref>{{cite web|title=Delaney and Speroni Sign New Deals|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2016/june/delaney-and-speroni-sign-new-deals/|publisher=Crystal Palace|accessdate=15 September 2016|date=13 June 2016}}</ref> He signed another one-year contract extension on 13 June 2016 to remain with the club until the end of [[2016-17 Premier League|2016–17 season]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Crystal Palace duo Julian Speroni and Damien Delaney sign new one-year deals|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36520014|publisher=BBC|accessdate=15 September 2016|date=13 June 2016}}</ref> On 14 October 2017 he was named a starter in Palace's match day squad again, helping them to a 2–1 win over defending champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/october/match-report-for-crystal-palace-vs-chelsea-on-14-oct-17/|title=Crystal Palace FC Report: Crystal Palace 2–1 Chelsea|access-date=2017-10-14}}</ref>
==International career==
In November 1998, Speroni was named in the squad for a friendly against Japan U20 in Tokyo.<ref>{{cite web|title=La nómina del Sub 21|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/117437-la-nomina-del-sub-21|publisher=La Nacion|accessdate=26 February 2014|language=Spanish|date=11 November 1998}}</ref> In December 1998, he was called into the Argentina U20 pre-selection squad for the [[1999 South American U-20 Championship]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Farías y Duscher se agregaron al plantel|url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/1998/12/27/r-06601d.htm|publisher=clarin.com|accessdate=26 February 2014|language=Spanish|date=27 December 1998}}</ref> Argentina's under 20 team played friendlies against Hungary and Denmark. On 30 December [[José Pékerman]] did not name him in the final squad.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ya está la lis20|url=http://pdf.diariohoy.net/1998/12/30/cla6y7.pdf|publisher=diariohoy.net|accessdate=26 February 2014|language=Spanish|date=30 December 1998|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140307004221/http://pdf.diariohoy.net/1998/12/30/cla6y7.pdf|archive-date=7 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Speroni made one appearance for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] team.<ref>http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/9163143/crystal-palace-goalkeeper-julian-speroni-targets-argentina-place</ref>
==Personal life== Speroni also holds an Italian passport, for which he qualified through his grandfather.<ref name="Interview with Speroni 2002"/>
Speroni owned a restaurant in [[Purley, London|Purley]], south London that was named 'Speroni's.'<ref>{{cite web|title=Crystal Palace keeper Julian Speroni opens new restaurant|url=http://www.croydonadvertiser.co.uk/Crystal-Palace-keeper-Julian-Speroni-opens-new/story-20521896-detail/story.html|publisher=Croydon Advertiser|accessdate=26 February 2014|date=29 January 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302014112/http://www.croydonadvertiser.co.uk/Crystal-Palace-keeper-Julian-Speroni-opens-new/story-20521896-detail/story.html|archive-date=2 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The restaurant closed in October 2016 following "structural issues" <ref>{{cite web|title=Crystal Palace legend Julian Speroni reveals why his Purley restaurant closed down|url=http://www.croydonadvertiser.co.uk/8203-more-detail-revealed-about-why-julian-speroni-s-restaurant-closed-down/story-30016499-detail/story.html|publisher=Croydon Advertiser|accessdate=18 May 2017|date=28 December 2016}}</ref>
Speroni is also on the board of reference for Christian Solidarity Worldwide (CSW), an organisation working for religious freedom through advocacy and human rights.<ref>{{cite web|last=CSW|title=Our Team|url=http://www.csw.org.uk/ourteam.htm|website=CSW|accessdate=6 July 2016}}</ref>

nationalgoals7 = 0 | pcupdate = 18:44, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16 October 2018 }} '''Patrick John Miguel van Aanholt''' (born 29 August 1990) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Full back (association football)|left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. He began his professional career at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], where he was used sparingly, spending time on loan at five other clubs. He joined [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] for around £1.5 million in 2014 and was transferred to Crystal Palace in January 2017, for a fee rising to £14 million. Van Aanholt represented the Netherlands at numerous youth levels before making his [[Netherlands national football team|full international]] debut in 2013. ==Personal life== Van Aanholt was born in [['s-Hertogenbosch]] to parents from [[Curaçao]]. He is the cousin of fellow Dutch international [[Leroy Fer]], who currently plays for [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.kilburntimes.co.uk/sport/football/queens-park-rangers/qpr_midfielder_leroy_fer_looking_forward_to_facing_cousin_against_sunderland_1_3746231|title=QPR midfielder Leroy Fer looking forward to facing cousin against Sunderland|first=Rob|last=Brennan}} ==Club career== [[File:Patrick van Aanholt 4740.jpg|thumbnail|left|Van Aanholt playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2010.|alt=|250x250px]] ===Chelsea=== Van Aanholt joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]'s youth ranks in 2007, making his professional debut while on loan at [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on 9 August 2009 in a 2–1 [[Football League Championship]] win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].{{cite web | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8187233.stm | title=Coventry 2–1 Ipswich | publisher=BBC Sport | date=9 August 2009 | accessdate=7 August 2010}} He was later recalled to Chelsea in December due to the exit of many players due to the [[African Nations Cup]]. Van Aanholt was first selected for Chelsea in an [[FA Cup]] tie away to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the [[FA Cup 2009–10|2009–10]] edition of the Cup, wearing the squad number 52, but did not make an appearance, remaining on the bench. He made his Chelsea debut on 24 March 2010 in a 0–5 away win at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], replacing [[Yuri Zhirkov]] at left-back after 71 minutes.{{cite news|title=Portsmouth 0–5 Chelsea|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8580687.stm|accessdate=8 August 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=24 March 2010}} He then made his home debut, on 27 March 2010, against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 7–1 victory, again as a substitute.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2010/03/27/1852127/premier-league-player-ratings-chelsea-7-1-aston-villa|title=Premier League Player Ratings: Chelsea 7–1 Aston Villa |date=27 March 2010}} On 29 January 2010, Van Aanholt joined [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on a one-month loan deal after regular left back [[José Enrique (footballer)|José Enrique]] suffered an injury. He provided cover for the Spaniard, sustaining Newcastle's productive left flank alongside [[Jonás Gutiérrez]]. Van Aanholt played his last game in the 1–2 away victory at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. Van Aanholt scored his first career goal on 22 September 2010 in the 4–3 defeat to former club Newcastle in the [[2010–11 Football League Cup|League Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=307975&cc=5739|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100926130707/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=307975&cc=5739|archivedate=26 September 2010|title=Ameobi sends Chelsea crashing out|date=22 September 2010|work=ESPN Soccernet|accessdate=2010-12-08}} On 26 January 2011, he joined [[Leicester City F.C|Leicester City]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11668_6703047,00.html | title=Foxes clinch Van Aanholt loan |work=Sky Sports | date=26 January 2011 |accessdate=26 January 2011}} He made his debut in a 1–0 win over [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on 1 February 2011,{{cite news|title = Sheff Utd 0 – 1 Leicester|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/9379936.stm|publisher = BBC Sport|date = 1 February 2011|accessdate = 1 March 2011}} and suffered a torn muscle in his thigh at the end of the month after playing six games.{{cite news|title = Leicester's Patrick van Aanholt set to miss a month|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/leicester_city/9410062.stm|publisher = BBC Sport|date = 28 February 2011|accessdate = 1 March 2011}} Van Aanholt scored his first senior league goal in a 4–0 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 9 April 2011.{{cite news|title = Leicester City vs Burnley|url = http://www.lcfc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10274~52285,00.html|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110413061448/http://www.lcfc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10274~52285,00.html|archivedate = 13 April 2011|publisher = Leicester City F.C.|date = 9 April 2011|accessdate = 9 April 2011}} On transfer deadline day, 31 August 2011, Van Aanholt signed for [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on a season-long loan deal.{{cite web|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/31082011/58/spl-wigan-sign-maloney-celtic.html|title=Yahoo UK & Ireland – Sports News – Live Scores – Results}} Van Aanholt's loan spell, originally a season-long arrangement, was later terminated by mutual consent between all three parties. During this uneventful loan spell, Van Aanholt played three league matches and one League Cup tie for the ''Latics'', but did not feature in their first team after 1 October.{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2568792|title=Chelsea FC:Latest News|date=1 October 2011|accessdate=6 July 2014}} ====Vitesse (loan spells)==== [[File:Patrick van Aanholt (2012).jpg|left|thumb|207x207px|Van Aanholt with [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] in 2012.]] On 6 January 2012, Van Aanholt returned to Chelsea during a season-long loan at Wigan. Nine days later, he signed for Dutch club [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] on loan until the end of the season, alongside fellow Chelsea teammates [[Tomáš Kalas]] and [[Ulises Dávila]]. On 11 July 2012, Van Aanholt rejoined Vitesse on a new loan deal for the [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13 season]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2841591|title=VITESSE LOANS FOR YOUNG PAIR}} On 7 July 2013, the Vitesse loan deal was extended for the [[2013–14 Eredivisie|2013–14 season]]. He made his first start of the [[2013–14 Vitesse season|2013–14 season]] in a 1–1 first leg draw away at [[FC Petrolul Ploiești|Petrolul Ploiești]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]], a match in which he was booked in the 86th minute.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000467/match=2012363/index.html|title=UEFA Europa League 2013/14 – History – Petrolul-Vitesse – UEFA|last=uefa.com}} He went on to start eight of the next nine league fixtures for Vitesse,{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=51881&season_id=143|title=Patrick van Aanholt – Football Stats – Crystal Palace – Season 2013/2014 – Soccer Base|website=soccerbase.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=2692&teamTabs=results&season_id=143|title=Latest Vitesse Arn. Results, Fixtures & Betting Odds – Soccer Base|website=soccerbase.com}} including earning an assist in a 1–1 draw at [[Roda JC Kerkrade|Roda JC]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/08/17/netherlands/eredivisie/roda-jc/sbv-vitesse/1478352/|title=Roda JC vs. Vitesse – 17 August 2013 – Soccerway}} On 7 December 2013, Van Aanholt netted Vitesse's fifth goal in a 2–6 away victory over [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], keeping Vitesse at the top of the [[Eredivisie]] table.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25287088 |title=Vitesse Arnhem hammered PSV Eindhoven to keep their place at the top of the Dutch table. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 December 2013 |accessdate=9 December 2013 }} ===Sunderland=== [[File:Patrick van Aanholt in 2015 (cropped).jpg|alt=|thumb|278x278px|Van Aanholt playing for [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in 2015.]] ====2014–15 season==== On 25 July 2014, Van Aanholt left Chelsea and signed for [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] for an undisclosed fee, believed to be between £1.5–2 million, on a four-year contract.{{cite news|title=Sunderland sign Patrick van Aanholt from Chelsea|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9394844/transfer-news-sunderland-sign-patrick-van-aanholt-from-chelsea|publisher=Sky Sports|date=25 July 2014|accessdate=25 July 2014}} He made his competitive debut on 16 August as Sunderland began their [[Premier League]] campaign away to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], assisting [[Sebastian Larsson]] for the final goal of a 2–2 draw.{{cite news|last1=Strickland|first1=Jamie|title=West Brom 2–2 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718388|accessdate=25 August 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=16 August 2014}} On 3 November, as Sunderland won 1–3 at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]; Van Aanholt set up the opening goal for [[Steven Fletcher (footballer)|Steven Fletcher]], but was later stretchered off in the first-half with a shoulder injury and replaced by [[Wes Brown]].{{cite news|title=Patrick van Aanholt: Sunderland defender injures shoulder|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29890554|accessdate=3 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 November 2014}} Van Aanholt scored his first goal for Sunderland on his return from injury on 4 January 2015, the only goal in an [[FA Cup]] third round win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{cite news|last1=Williams|first1=Adam|title=Sunderland 1–0 Leeds|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30614387|accessdate=4 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} ====2015–16 season==== On 28 November 2015, Van Aanholt scored the first goal in a 2–0 at home to [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].{{cite news|title=Sunderland 2–0 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34887488|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2015}} He scored his second of the season on 16 January 2016, where he gave Sunderland the lead against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], although Sunderland would go on to lose 4–1.{{cite news|title=Spurs 4–1 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35270647|publisher=BBC Sport}} His third of the season came the following week, on 23 January 2016, where he scored the equaliser in a 1–1 draw at home to [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]].{{cite news|title=Sunderland 1–1 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35330994|publisher=BBC Sport}} He scored his fourth goal of the season when he opened the scoring with a 25-yard free-kick in a 3–0 win against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. The result sealed Sunderland's Premier League safety, and relegated local rivals Newcastle United, along with [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news|title=Sunderland 3–0 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35733486|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 8 June 2016, Van Aanholt put pen to paper, signing a new four-year deal, keeping him at the club until the year 2020.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/SunderlandAFC/status/740528862627520512?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw |title=Van Aanholt signs new deal |accessdate=8 June 2016|work=Sunderland's Official Twitter|date=8 June 2016}}{{Primary source inline|date=January 2018}} [[File:Patrick van Aanholt in 2017 (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|286x286px|Van Aanholt playing for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in 2017.]] ====2016–17 season==== On 13 August 2016, in the opening game of the season, Van Aanholt conceded an early penalty, as Sunderland fell to a 2–1 defeat at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994521 |title= Manchester City 2–1 Sunderland|publisher = BBC Sport}} He scored his first goal of the [[2016–17 Premier League|season]] on 21 August 2016 in a 1–2 Premier League defeat to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37075121 |title=Sunderland 1–2 Middlesbrough|publisher = BBC Sport}} On 1 October, he came off the bench to score a late equaliser in a 1–1 draw at home to West Brom.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37459853 |title=Sunderland 1–1 West Bromwich Albion|publisher = BBC Sport}} Van Aanholt scored his third goal of the season on 17 December to give Sunderland a 1–0 home win against Watford.{{cite web|url=http://www.scoresway.com/?sport=soccer&page=match&id=2241925 |title=SUNDERLAND VS WATFORD 1–0}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 30 January 2017, it was confirmed that Van Aanholt had moved to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on a four-and-a-half-year deal for an initial fee of £9 million, rising to £14 million, rejoining his former Sunderland manager [[Sam Allardyce]]. He was given the number 3 shirt.{{cite news|last=Muro|first=Giuseppe|title=Allardyce gets Van Aanholt but he's still in the market|date=30 January 2017|work=London Evening Standard|page= 63|location =London UK}} Van Aanholt made his first appearance for the Eagles in a 2–0 win at [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] on 31 January.{{cite news|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/february/van-aanholt-we-were-solid--compact/|title=Van Aanholt: We Were Solid & Compact|date=1 February 2017|work=Crystal Palace Football Club}} His home debut, a 0–4 loss to former club Sunderland at [[Selhurst Park]], came four days later.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/feb/04/crystal-palace-sunderland-premier-league-match-report|title=Sunderland's Jermain Defoe heaps misery on broken Crystal Palace|date=5 February 2017|work=The Guardian}} On 25 February 2017, Van Aanholt scored his first goal for Crystal Palace; the only goal of a 1–0 victory against relegation rivals [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/feb/25/crystal-palace-middlesbrough-premier-league-match-report|title=Crystal Palace out of drop zone after Patrick van Aanholt goal sinks Boro|date=26 February 2017|work=The Guardian}} ==International career== On 19 November 2013, Van Aanholt won his first senior cap for the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] in a friendly match against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]], coming on in injury time for [[Memphis Depay]] in a 0–0 draw at the [[Amsterdam Arena]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2014/matches/round=2000374/match=2013101/postmatch/report/ |title=Netherlands cling on against Colombia |publisher=UEFA |date=19 November 2013 |accessdate=9 December 2013 }} In September 2017, Van Aanholt was called up to the [[Curaçao national football team]] for a friendly against [[Qatar national football team|Qatar]], but he did not make an appearance.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/van-aanholt-called-curacao/|title=Van Aanholt Called Up by Curacao - Football Oranje|date=26 September 2017|publisher=}} As all his international appearances for Netherlands had been in friendly matches, he was still eligible to represent Curaçao.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/van-aanholt-called-curacao/|title=Van Aanholt Called Up by Curacao - Football Oranje|date=26 September 2017|publisher=}} He was included in [[Ronald Koeman]]’s first starting line up when [[Dutch national football team|Holland]] took on [[England national football team|England]] on March 23, 2018 in a friendly international.{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/march/van-aanholt-wins-seventh-dutch-cap/|title=Van Aanholt Wins Seventh Netherlands Cap|publisher=}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 9 March 2019.}}{{cite news|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=51881|title=Games played by Patrick van Aanholt|date=16 November 2013|accessdate=16 November 2013}}

*League Only as Soccerbase don't count Dutch Cup and Europa League matches for whatever reason*{{cite news|url=http://espnfc.com/player/_/id/138746/patrick-van-aanholt?cc=5739|title=Patrick van Aanholt Appearances|date=16 November 2013|accessdate=16 November 2013}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Luka Milivojević | image = Milivojevic 2018.jpg | image_size = | caption = Milivojević with [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] | fullname = Luka Milivojević<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/465277 |title=Squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2017 |accessdate=21 December 2017}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|4|7|df=y}}<ref name=BDFutbol>{{cite web |url=http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/j/j25289.html |title=Milivojević: Luka Milivojević: Player |publisher=BDFutbol |accessdate=21 December 2017}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Kragujevac]], SFR Yugoslavia<ref name=BDFutbol/> | height = 1.86 m<ref name=BDFutbol/> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | clubnumber = 4 | years1 = 2007–2008 | clubs1 = [[FK Radnički Kragujevac|Radnički Kragujevac]] | caps1 = 5 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2008–2012 | clubs2 = [[FK Rad|Rad]] | caps2 = 49 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2012–2013 | clubs3 = [[Red Star Belgrade]] | caps3 = 36 | goals3 = 7 | years4 = 2013–2014 | clubs4 = [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] | caps4 = 19 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2014–2017 | clubs5 = [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] | caps5 = 62 | goals5 = 11 | years6 = 2017– | clubs6 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps6 = 80 | goals6 = 21 | nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[Serbia national under-21 football team|Serbia U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 11 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2012– | nationalteam2 = [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] | nationalcaps2 = 30 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | pcupdate = 14:44, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 22 June 2018 }} '''Luka Milivojević''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Лука Миливојевић}}, {{IPA-sh|lûːka miliʋǒːjeʋitɕ|pron}}; born 7 April 1991) is a Serbian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] and [[Captain (association football)|captains]] {{English football updater|CrystalP}} club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] and the [[Serbia national football team|Serbian national team]].
He began his career with [[FK Radnički Kragujevac|Radnički Kragujevac]] and then played for [[FK Rad|Rad]] before signing for [[Red Star Belgrade]] in January 2012. He later won the [[Belgian Pro League]] with [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] and [[Superleague Greece]] twice with [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] before a €16 million transfer to Crystal Palace in January 2017. Milivojević made his international debut for Serbia in 2012 and was part of their squad at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early years=== Milivojević's first season as senior was with his home town club [[FK Radnički Kragujevac|Radnički Kragujevac]] during the 2007–08 season, then playing in the [[Serbian League West]]. At the end of that season he moved to the top league club [[FK Rad|Rad]] entered into the senior team in the [[2008–09 Serbian SuperLiga|2008–09]] season. He played as right side midfielder.
===Red Star Belgrade=== Milivojević signed for [[Red Star Belgrade]] on 19 December 2011.<ref>[http://www.novimagazin.rs/sport/luka-milivojeviluka-milivojevic-srean-zbog-dolaska-u-zvezdu Novi Magazin (Serbian): Luka Milivojević potpisao za Zvezdu] 19 December 2012</ref> His arrival to Red Star was largely due to the desire of coach [[Robert Prosinečki]], who believed that Milivojević had bright potential. On 17 November 2012, Milivojević scored an impressive goal against city rivals [[FK Partizan|Partizan]].<ref>[http://sport.blic.rs/Fudbal/Domaci-fudbal/223658/Milivojevic-Ceo-zivot-sam-sanjao-i-molio-Boga-da-dam-gol-Partizanu] Blic Sport: Milivojević: Ceo život sam sanjao i molio Boga da dam gol Partizanu {{sr icon}} 18 November 2012</ref>
===Anderlecht=== On 26 July 2013, Milivojević signed a five-year contract with [[Belgian]] football giants [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]].<ref>[http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/anderlecht/transfer-talk/news/milivojevic-joins-anderlecht_95417.html] Sports Mole: Milivojević joins Anderlecht (28 July 2013)</ref> On 1 September 2014, it was announced that Milivojević had joined [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] on loan from Anderlecht.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.olympiacos.org/article/40270/sta-%C2%ABerythroleyka%C2%BB-o-milibogebits|script-title=el:Στα «ερυθρόλευκα» ο Μιλιβόγεβιτς|date=1 September 2014|accessdate=5 September 2014|language=Greek|publisher=Olympiacos.org}}</ref>
After the 2014–15 season, Milivojević reiterated his desire to stay with Olympiacos. The two clubs could have started new negotiations after the season ended; Milivojević stated that his wish was to make the move permanent.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/30944/milivojevic-wants-to-commit-his-future-to-olympiakos/|title=Milivojević wants to commit his future to Olympiakos|date=19 April 2015|publisher=www.sdna.gr}}</ref> According to reports in Belgium, Olympiacos were to meet Anderlecht's asking price in order to complete the permanent transfer of Milivojević. Olympiacos were in negotiations with the Belgian club as they were reluctant to pay the €2.7 million Anderlecht asked for Milivojević.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/31165/olympiakos-poised-to-activate-milivojevic-buy-out-clause/|title=Olympiakos poised to activate Milivojevic buy-out clause|date=20 April 2015|publisher=www.sdna.gr}}</ref>
===Olympiacos=== On 4 June 2015, Anderlecht confirmed that it had reached an agreement with Olympiacos for the permanent transfer of Milivojević. He had spent a season with the club, and joined the Greek champions by signing a four-year contract, for a fee of €2.3 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lameuse.be/1303542/article/2015-06-04/anderlecht-cede-definitivement-luka-milivojevic-a-olympiacos|title=Anderlecht cède définitivement Luka Milivojevic à Olympiacos |date=4 June 2015|publisher=www.lameuse.be}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.olympiacos.org/article/48508/thrylos-kai-milibogebits-synexizoyn-mazi|title=Θρύλος και Μιλιβόγεβιτς συνεχίζουν μαζί!|date=4 June 2015|publisher=www.olympiacos.org}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport24.gr/football/omades/Olympiakos/synexizei-ston-olympiako-o-milivogevits.3509826.html|title=Μιλιβόγεβιτς ως το 2019|date=4 June 2015|publisher=www.sport24.gr}}</ref> On 30 June 2015, Olympiacos turned down a bid in the region of €5 million from [[Fenerbahce]].
===Crystal Palace=== [[File:Manchester United v Crystal Palace, 30 September 2017 (12).jpg|thumb|Milivojević in action against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]]] On 31 January 2017, Milivojević signed for Crystal Palace on a three-and-a-half year contract for almost €16 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=Milivojevic Joins The Eagles|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/january/milivojevic-joins-the-eagles/|publisher=Crystal Palace Official Site|accessdate=31 January 2017}}</ref> On 10 April 2017, he scored his first goal for Palace with a penalty kick in his team's 3–0 home win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/apr/10/crystal-palace-v-arsenal-premier-league-live|title=Crystal Palace v Arsenal: Premier League – live!|last=Butler|first=Michael|date=10 April 2017|work=The Guardian|access-date=10 April 2017|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> and got his other goal of the season on 14 May in a 4–0 win at [[Selhurst Park]] against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], which secured his team's place in the top flight for next season and relegated the opponents.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Johnston |first1=Neil |title=Crystal Palace 4–0 Hull City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39833968 |accessdate=11 March 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 May 2017}}</ref>
In 2017–18, Milivojević was Palace's top scorer with 10 goals as the Eagles recovered from a poor start to the season to finish 11th under new manager [[Roy Hodgson]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace 2017/18 Premier League season review |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11706/11371101/crystal-palace-201718-premier-league-season-review |accessdate=11 March 2019 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 May 2018}}</ref> He developed a reputation for taking penalties, scoring nine of the ten he took in his first 1{{frac|1|2}} seasons with Palace; he had never taken a penalty in a professional match before.<ref>{{cite news |title=Milivojevic: Last 16 would be huge for Serbia |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/milivojevic-last-16-would-be-huge-for-serbia |accessdate=11 March 2019 |publisher=FIFA |date=14 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Milivojevic leads the way with penalty prowess |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/646864 |accessdate=11 March 2019 |publisher=Premier League |date=21 March 2018}}</ref> The one he did miss was on 31 December 2017 in added time at the end of a goalless draw against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], with [[Ederson Moraes|Ederson]] making a save for the team who had won their last 18 matches.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Delaney |first1=Miguel |title=Luka Milivojevic misses stoppage-time penalty as Crystal Palace end Manchester City's winning run |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/crystal-palace-manchester-city-luka-milivojevic-penalty-gabriel-jesus-injury-a8135726.html |accessdate=11 March 2019 |work=The Independent |date=31 December 2017}}</ref>
On 28 October 2018, Milivojević scored two penalties in a 2–2 home draw with Arsenal, ending the visitors' run of 12 consecutive victories.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Fifield |first1=Dominic |title=Crystal Palace’s Luka Milivojevic holds his nerve to end Arsenal’s winning run |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/oct/28/crystal-palace-arsenal-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=11 March 2019 |work=The Guardian |date=28 October 2018}}</ref> Away to Manchester City on 22 December, he scored the winning goal from the penalty spot in a 3–2 victory over the title holders.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Khan |first1=Alam |title=Manchester City vs Crystal Palace: Stunning defeat hands Liverpool the edge in title race |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-vs-crystal-palace-report-result-goals-league-andros-townsend-volley-watch-video-a8696211.html |accessdate=11 March 2019 |work=The Independent |date=22 December 2017}}</ref>
==International career== He was a member of the [[Serbia national under-21 football team]]. He had been called up for the [[Serbia national football team]] squad on 29 September 2011, to face [[Italy national football team|Italy]] and [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying phase]].<ref>[http://www.sportske.net/vest/domaci-fudbal/milivojevic-hvala-jankovicu-bicu-jos-bolji-52438.html Milivojević: "Hvala Jankoviću, biću još bolji''] at Sportske.net</ref> He made his debut for Serbia on 14 November 2012 in a friendly match with [[Chile national football team|Chile]].<ref>[http://www.mondo.rs/s266888/Sport/Fudbal/Orlovi_opet_poleteli.html Mondo (Serbian): "Orlovi" opet poleteli...] 14 November 2012</ref> On 6 October 2017 he scored his first goal for Serbia in a World Cup Qualifying match with [[Austria national football team|Austria]].<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/european-qualifiers/season=2018/matches/round=2000717/match=2017773/index.html] 6 October 2017</ref>
In June 2018, he was included in the final 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{Cite web | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-soccer-worldcup-srb-squad/soccer-krstajic-names-serbias-final-23-man-world-cup-squad-idUSKCN1IX5O2 | title=Soccer: Krstajic names Serbia's final 23-man World Cup squad | publisher=reuters.com | date=1 June 2018 | accessdate=6 June 2018}}</ref> There he appeared in two matches, against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]]<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44427970 | title = Costa Rica 0–1 Serbia | publisher = BBC Sport | author = Timothy Abraham | date = 17 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}}</ref> and [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44439145 | title = Serbia 1–2 Switzerland | publisher = BBC Sport | author = Matthew Henry | date = 23 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}}</ref>

football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 17:40, 9 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Scott Dann''' (born 14 February 1987) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. He began his [[Football League]] career with [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]], before moving on to [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] and then to [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in 2009. After Birmingham's relegation from the Premier League, Dann joined Blackburn in August 2011 and was the club's captain.
==Early life== Dann was born in [[Liverpool]], Merseyside,<ref name=Hugman1011/> and attended Archbishop Beck High School in the [[Walton, Liverpool|Walton]] district of the city. He is a former [[Liverpool F.C.]] season ticket holder.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fc-considering-move-birmingham-3375863 |title=Liverpool FC considering move for Birmingham City defender Scott Dann |first=James |last=Pearce |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=26 May 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2013}}</ref>
==Career== ===Walsall=== Dann joined [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] in 2003 as a junior after impressing on trial at the [[Bescot Stadium]], signing a professional contract with the Saddlers the following year. He moved up the ranks at Walsall to become a regular in the reserve team throughout 2004–05 and was allowed to join Danish side [[Køge BK]] on loan towards the end of the campaign.
Dann then joined [[Conference North]] side [[Redditch United F.C.|Redditch United]] on loan in October 2005 initially until the end of the season, but he was recalled in January 2006. He then Joined Redditch's league rivals [[Hednesford Town F.C.|Hednesford Town]] on loan following injuries to their regular centre-backs Richard Teesdale and Ian Wright. He played in three games for the Pitmen, against [[Hucknall Town F.C.|Hucknall Town]], [[Stafford Rangers F.C.|Stafford Rangers]] and [[Lancaster City F.C.|Lancaster City]], before injury put an end to his loan spell at [[Keys Park]]. He returned to Walsall and was put on a short-term contract for the 2006–07 season, where he earned his place in the starting line-up with a number of excellent performances at the back. His season was ended in March 2007 after picking up a metatarsal injury in the game against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]].
As reward for his outstanding season for the Saddlers, who were promoted as League Two Champions, Dann was given a three-year contract to commit him to the club and to ward off interest from a number of clubs higher up in the league.
===Coventry City=== His form in League One was equally as impressive as the previous season, so it was little surprise that in January 2008 Dann joined [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] for an undisclosed fee, suggested in the media to be "in excess of £1 million".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/scott-dann-follows-fox-to-coventry-57533 |title=Scott Dann follows Fox to Coventry from Walsall |first=Brian |last=Halford |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=1 February 2008 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> His impressive form for the Saddlers continued in the Championship for the Sky Blues alongside former Walsall teammate [[Daniel Fox (footballer)|Daniel Fox]], who had also moved to the [[Ricoh Arena]]. He helped the club narrowly avoid relegation. The England set-up had seen enough in Dann and Fox to decide they were ready to make the step up to international level, with both players making their U-21 debuts in March 2008 against Poland at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]].
Dann was appointed [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of Coventry City for the 2008–09 season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/scott-dann-named-coventry-city-3093103 |title=Scott Dann is named Coventry City captain |first=Andy |last=Turner |newspaper=Coventry Telegraph |date=4 August 2008 |accessdate=15 December 2013}}</ref>
===Birmingham City=== [[File:scottdannforwiki.png|thumb|upright|Dann in pre-season with [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in 2011|alt=Head and shoulders of young white man with dark spiky hair and wearing a sports shirt]]
Dann signed for [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on 12 June 2009 for an undisclosed fee, described as a "club record fee for a defender";<ref>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301133632/http://www.bcfc.com/page/News/NewsDetail/0,,10412~1691106,00.html |title=It's a Dann deal! |publisher=Birmingham City F.C |date=12 June 2009 |archivedate=1 March 2012 |url=http://www.bcfc.com/page/News/NewsDetail/0,,10412~1691106,00.html}}</ref> local press reports suggested the fee to be in the region of £3.5 million, with a possible increase to £4 million, with performance-based add-ons.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.birminghampost.co.uk/news/local-news/35m-scott-dann-given-premier-3944396 |title=£3.5m Scott Dann given Premier choice |work=Birmingham Post |date=12 June 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2013 |first=Robert |last=Tanner}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/alex-mcleish-tracked-scott-dann-3081475 |title=Alex McLeish had tracked Scott Dann 'long term' |work=Coventry Telegraph |date=12 June 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/scott-dann-fee-rise-4m-3081703 |title=Scott Dann fee may rise to £4m? |work=Coventry Telegraph |date=18 June 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2013}}</ref> Surgery during the summer and then a pulled thigh muscle meant Dann was not fully match fit when an injury to [[Franck Queudrue]] gave him the chance to make his [[Premier League]] debut on 19 September at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/birmingham-city-fit-again-scott-dann-103473 |title=Fit-again Scott Dann ready to step into line of fire at Hull City |first=Colin |last=Tattum |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=18 September 2009 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> Birmingham won 1–0, and Dann played well and retained his place in the starting eleven.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/birmingham-citys-scott-dann-can-247667 |title=Birmingham City's Scott Dann can blossom next season |first=Colin |last=Tattum |newspaper=Sunday Mercury |location=Birmingham |date=16 May 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2012 |quote=Due to injury, he had to wait his turn. But when Dann was pressed into action at Hull City despite not being fit or really up to speed – he played a debut blinder and the rest is history.}}</ref>
At Christmas 2009, ''[[The Times]]''' [[Patrick Barclay]] described Dann and defensive partner [[Roger Johnson (footballer)|Roger Johnson]] as "certainties" for his team of the season so far.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_ver=z39.88-2004&rft_id=info:sid/iw.newsbank.com:AWNB:LTIB&rft_val_format=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:ctx&rft_dat=12CD3BE4CDF8E398&svc_dat=InfoWeb:aggregated5&req_dat=0D0CB57AB53DF815 |title=Polished duo Roger Johnson and Scott Dann put case for the defence |first=Patrick |last=Barclay |newspaper=The Times |date=24 December 2009 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> His first goal for Birmingham came against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] in the [[FA Cup]] on 13 February 2010,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/8506578.stm |title=Derby 1–2 Birmingham |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 February 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref> during a run of 15 games unbeaten in all competitions, including a club record 12 unbeaten in the top flight.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1157547.html |title=Fresh fortunes at St Andrew's |publisher=FIFA |date= 15 January 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/colin-tattum-analyses-the-way-ahead-247665 |title=Colin Tattum analyses the way ahead for Birmingham City |first=Colin |last=Tattum |newspaper=Sunday Mercury |location=Birmingham |date=16 May 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> A calf injury sustained in training<ref>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120329235859/http://www.bcfc.com/page/News/NewsDetail/0,,10412~2034804,00.html |title=McLeish: We didn't deserve that |publisher=Birmingham City F.C |date=25 April 2010 |archivedate=29 March 2012|url=http://www.bcfc.com/page/News/NewsDetail/0,,10412~2034804,00.html }}</ref> caused him to miss the last three games of the season as the club finished in ninth place, their best for more than 50 years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8656538.stm |title= Bolton 2–1 Birmingham |first=Les |last=Roopanarine |date=9 May 2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
Dann scored the opening goal as Birmingham beat a [[Hong Kong League XI|Hong Kong XI]] 3–2 in an invitation match branded the Xtep Cup, part of the club's 2010 pre-season tour of the Far East,<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.scmp.com/article/720088/city-match-finishes-black-say-organisers |title=City match finishes in black, say organisers |last=Chan Kin-wa |newspaper=South China Morning Post |date=19 July 2010 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> and his first Premier League goal, a header from a [[Sebastian Larsson]] cross, on the opening weekend of the 2010–11 season as Birmingham drew 2–2 away at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8901729.stm |title=Sunderland 2–2 Birmingham |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=14 August 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Following surgery on a hamstring damaged in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] semi-final in January 2011, Dann was ruled out for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/birmingham_city/9363414.stm |title=Birmingham's Scott Dann ruled out for rest of season |date=20 January 2011 |accessdate=20 January 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> The club were relegated from the Premier League on the final day of the season.
===Blackburn Rovers=== [[File:ScottDannBlackburnRovers.JPG|thumb|upright|Dann with [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in 2013]]
On 31 August 2011, the last day of the transfer window, [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] signed Dann on a four-year deal for an officially undisclosed fee, reported by [[BBC Sport]] as £6 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/blackburn_rovers/news/9226112.Dann_joins_Blackburn_Rovers/ |title=A Dann deal as Birmingham City defender joins Blackburn Rovers |work=Lancashire Telegraph |date=31 August 2011 |accessdate=13 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14740455.stm |title=Birmingham defender Scott Dann signs for Blackburn Rovers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2011 |accessdate=19 December 2011}}</ref> Dann said that manager [[Steve Kean]], with whom he had worked at Coventry, was "a big factor" in his decision to join the [[Ewood Park]] club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11661_7141883,00.html |title=Dann happy with Rovers move |first=Pete |last=O'Rourke |publisher=Sky Sports |date=1 September 2011 |accessdate=1 September 2011}}</ref> He was given squad number 16.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.footballsquads.co.uk/eng/2011-2012/faprem/blackbrn.htm |title=Blackburn Rovers 2011/12 |publisher=FootballSquads |accessdate=13 February 2013}}</ref> On 11 September, he made his debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] at [[Craven Cottage]], starting alongside [[Christopher Samba]] and completing the full 90 minutes as Rovers earned their first point of the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14778563 |title=Fulham 1–1 Blackburn |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 September 2011 |accessdate=4 December 2012}}</ref> During the 2–1 home defeat to [[West Bromwich Albion]] in December, Dann scored his first goal for Rovers, but also suffered a [[Testicular rupture|ruptured testicle]], an injury which was expected to keep him out for six weeks.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/998927/blackburn%27s-scott-dann-out-for-six-weeks-with-ruptured-testicle?cc=5739# |title=Dann ruled out for six weeks |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=19 December 2011 |accessdate=13 February 2013}}</ref> At the end of the 2011–12 season, Dann made a total of 28 appearances in all competitions and also suffered relegation for the third time in his career as Rovers finished in 19th place in the Premier League.{{citation needed|date=August 2012}}
On 12 March 2013, Dann was officially confirmed as captain of the club, succeeding [[Danny Murphy (footballer born 1977)|Danny Murphy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11688/8559340/Scott-Dann-is-the-new-captain-of-Blackburn-replacing-Danny-Murphy |title=Scott Dann is the new captain of Blackburn replacing Danny Murphy |publisher=Sky Sports |date=12 March 2013 |accessdate=12 March 2013}}</ref>
===Crystal Palace=== On 31 January 2014, Dann signed a three-and-a-half-year deal with Premier League club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/january/palace-swoop-for-dann/ |title=Palace swoop for Dann |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref> He made his debut on 8 February in a 3–1 home win against [[West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25995046 |title=Crystal Palace 3–1 West Brom |first=Graham |last=Chase |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 February 2014 |accessdate=9 February 2014}}</ref>
Dann won the club's [[Crystal Palace F.C. Player of the Year|Player of the Year]] award for 2014–15,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/may/dann-named-crystal-palace-player-of-the-year/ |title=Dann named Crystal Palace Player of the Year |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=13 May 2015 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> followed by the Player's Player of the Year award for 2015–16.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2016/may/dann-named-players-player-of-the-year/ |title=Dann named Players' Player of the Year |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=12 May 2016 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>
In July 2015 he signed a new five-year contract with the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/july/dann-signs-new-five-year-contract/ |title=Dann signs 5 year contract |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |accessdate=13 July 2015}}</ref>
Ahead of the 2016–17 season, Dann replaced [[Mile Jedinak]] as captain.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/crystal-palace/story/2922090/scott-dann-replaces-mile-jedinak-as-crystal-palace-captain |title=Scott Dann replaces Mile Jedinak as Crystal Palace captain |website=ESPN.com |agency=AAP |date=3 August 2016 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> He was succeeded by [[Jason Puncheon]] for 2017–18.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/july/puncheon-confirmed-as-palace-captain/ |title=Puncheon Confirmed As Palace Captain |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=18 July 2017 |accessdate=21 November 2017}}</ref> Both Dann and Puncheon suffered [[cruciate ligament]] injuries in the same match, against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in December 2017, that kept them out for the rest of the season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/01/crystal-palace-fear-losing-scott-dann-and-jason-puncheon-for-rest-of-season-injuries |title=Crystal Palace's Scott Dann and Jason Puncheon ruled out for rest of season |first1=Dominic |last1=Fifield |first2=Nick |last2=Miller |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=2 January 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> Dann returned to action just over a year later, starting in the FA Cup third round match against [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/01/05/jordan-ayew-comes-bench-save-crystal-palace-blushes-against/ |title=Jordan Ayew comes off bench to save Crystal Palace blushes against Grimsby Town in closely fought FA Cup tie |first=Pippa |last=Field |newspaper=Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=5 January 2019 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Cheikhou Kouyaté | image = West Ham United Vs Manchester City (24642418901) (cropped).jpg | image_size = | caption = Kouyaté with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2016 | fullname = Cheikhou Kouyaté<ref>{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|12|21|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Dakar]], Senegal | height = 1.89 m<ref>{{cite web |url= http://m.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/playerprofile.html/cheikhou-kouyate |title= Premier League Player Profile Cheikhou Kouyaté |author= <!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |year= 2015 |publisher= Premier League |accessdate= 26 January 2015 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150219043727/http://m.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/playerprofile.html/cheikhou-kouyate |archivedate= 19 February 2015 |df= }}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]], [[Defender (association football)|defender]] | currentclub = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | clubnumber = 8 | youthyears1 = 1996–2006 | youthclubs1 = ASC Yego Dakar | youthyears2 = 2006–2007 | youthclubs2 = [[RWDM Brussels FC|RWDM Brussels]] | years1 = 2007–2008 | clubs1 = [[RWDM Brussels FC|RWDM Brussels]] | caps1 = 10 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2008–2014 | clubs2 = [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] | caps2 = 153 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2008–2009 | clubs3 = → [[K.V. Kortrijk|Kortrijk]] (loan) | caps3 = 26 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2014–2018 | clubs4 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps4 = 129 | goals4 = 12 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps5 = 24 | goals5 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Senegal national under-20 football team|Senegal U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Senegal national under-23 football team|Senegal Olympic]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2012– | nationalteam3 = [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] | nationalcaps3 = 46 | nationalgoals3 = 2 | pcupdate = 21:54, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 18:40, 28 June 2018 (UTC) }} '''Cheikhou Kouyaté''' (born 21 December 1989) is a Senegalese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Centre midfielder|central midfielder]] for English club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] and [[Captain (association football)|captains]] the [[Senegal national football team|Senegal national team]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/kouyate-signs-for-palace/|title=Kouyate Signs For Palace|access-date=2018-08-01|language=en-gb}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45040236|title=Cheikhou Kouyate: Crystal Palace sign midfielder from West Ham|date=2018-08-01|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-08-01|language=en-GB}}</ref>
Kouyaté moved from Senegal to Belgium in 2006, having been offered a youth contract at [[RWDM Brussels FC|RWDM Brussels]]. After breaking into the first team, he went on to play just ten appearances before moving to [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] aged 19. In June 2014, he joined West Ham of the [[Premier League]]. He represented the [[Senegal national football team|Senegal national team]] at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]].
==Career== [[File:Cheikhou Kouyaté makes dua.jpg|thumb|left|100px|Kouyaté praying before a West Ham match, 2014]]
===Early career=== Kouyaté began his footballing career in 1996 in his hometown with ASC Yego Dakar and was scouted by [[RWDM Brussels FC|RWDM Brussels]] in September 2006. RWDM Brussels then signed the player in January the following year.<ref>[http://www.rwdm-fcbrussels.be/12-PLAYERS/fiche-fcbrussels-players.html FC BRUSSELS Players] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430152814/http://www.rwdm-fcbrussels.be/12-PLAYERS/fiche-fcbrussels-players.html |date=30 April 2009 }} on www.rwdm-brussels.be</ref> He went on to play ten league appearances for the first team between 2007 and 2008.<ref name="whufc1">{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/cheikhou-kouyate-west-ham_2228487_49276 |title=CHEIKHOU KOUYATE |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |accessdate=1 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150115021426/http://www.whufc.com/articles/cheikhou-kouyate-west-ham_2228487_49276 |archivedate=15 January 2015 |df= }}</ref>
===Anderlecht=== As Kouyaté turned 19, he left Brussels because his former employers did not pay him three months' worth of wages. He subsequently moved to Belgian rivals [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] on a four-year deal for a free transfer.<ref>[http://www.nieuwsblad.be/sportwereld/Article/Detail.aspx?ArticleID=T31U96TG Cheikhou Kouyaté moet van de rechter naar Anderlecht] on www.nieuwsblad.be</ref> After a loan to KV Kortrijk, he returned to Anderlecht. Kouyaté went on to make 153 league appearances for Anderlecht, scoring four goals in five seasons at the club. He won the [[2009–10 Belgian Pro League|2009–10]], [[2011-12 Belgian Pro League|2011–12]], [[2012-13 Belgian Pro League|2012–13]] and [[2013–14 Belgian Pro League|2013–14]] [[Belgian Pro League|league titles]] as well as the 2010–11, 2012–13 and 2013–14 [[Belgian Super Cup]]s.<ref name=whufc1/><ref name = Soccerway>{{Soccerway|-cheikhou-kouyate/53112}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== ====2014–15 season==== On 18 June 2014, Kouyaté signed for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a four-year contract.<ref>[http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140618/hammers-complete-kouyate-transfer_2236884_3914133 Hammers complete Kouyate transfer] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141028083133/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140618/hammers-complete-kouyate-transfer_2236884_3914133 |date=28 October 2014 }} on www.whufc.com</ref> He made his West Ham debut on 16 August 2014 in a 1–0 home defeat to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. His performance was described as "impressive" by the [[BBC]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rose|first1=Gary|title=West Ham United 0–1 Tottenham Hotspur|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718387|accessdate=6 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 August 2014}}</ref> The following week, manager [[Sam Allardyce]] compared him to ex-[[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] captain [[Patrick Vieira]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/sam-allardyce-when-i-look-at-west-ham-signing-cheikhou-kouyate-i-see-patrick-vieira-9685256.html|title=Sam Allardyce: When I look at West Ham signing Cheikhou Kouyate I see Patrick Vieira|work=London Evening Standard|accessdate=21 September 2014}}</ref> On 28 December, Kouyaté scored his first West Ham goal in a 1–2 defeat to Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/sport/West-Ham-United-1-2-Arsenal | title=West Ham United 1–2 Arsenal | work=Jamaica Observer | accessdate=29 December 2014}}</ref> His second goal of the season came on 8 February 2015 in a 1–1 draw with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. His performance in the game won praise from manager Allardyce for Kouyaté's Man of the Match performance which was also singled out as the Individual Performance of the Season, by a West Ham player, at the clubs' annual awards.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.london24.com/sport/football/clubs/west-ham/allardyce_singles_out_west_ham_star_for_special_praise_after_manchester_united_draw_1_3948078 |title=Allardyce singles out West Ham star for special praise after Manchester United draw |publisher=london24.com |accessdate=31 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150427052105/http://www.london24.com/sport/football/clubs/west-ham/allardyce_singles_out_west_ham_star_for_special_praise_after_manchester_united_draw_1_3948078 |archivedate=27 April 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/May/8-May/Kouyate-s-vote-of-thanks | title=Kouyate's vote of thanks | publisher=West Ham United F.C. | accessdate=31 May 2015 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150511001706/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2015/May/8-May/Kouyate-s-vote-of-thanks | archivedate=11 May 2015 | df= }}</ref> He scored two further goals in the season, in a 2–2 away draw with Tottenham and in a 2–1 away defeat to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31476002 | title=Tottenham 2–2 West Ham | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=31 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32097799 | title=Leicester City 2–1 West Ham United | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=31 May 2015}}</ref> Kouyaté finished the season having played 31 out of a possible 38 [[Premier League]] games.<ref>{{Soccerbase season|57209|2014|access-date=31 May 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== On 9 August 2015, Kouyaté scored the opening goal in the 43rd minute in a 2–0 win over Arsenal at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Osborne|first1=Chris|title=Arsenal 0–2 West Ham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750502|accessdate=10 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2015}}</ref> He then scored in a 4–3 home defeat to [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] on 22 August.<ref>{{cite web|title = West Ham United 3 - 4 AFC Bournemouth Match report - 22/08/2015 Premier League — Goal.com|url = http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/west-ham-united-vs-afc-bournemouth/2043066/report|website = goal.com|accessdate = 26 September 2015}}</ref> He scored his third goal of the season in a 2–2 draw with [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 26 September, netting the equalizer in the 90th minute to rescue a point for West Ham.<ref>{{Cite news|title = West Ham United 2–2 Norwich City|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299547|publisher = BBC Sport|access-date = 26 September 2015}}</ref> In March 2016, Kouyate signed a new, five-year contract with West Ham that could keep him at the club until 2021.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/March/18-March/Cheik%E2%80%99s-in-for-five-more-years! | title=Cheik's in for five more years! | publisher=West Ham United F.C. | date=18 March 2016 | accessdate=25 March 2016 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160320203623/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/March/18-March/Cheik%E2%80%99s-in-for-five-more-years! | archive-date=20 March 2016 | dead-url=yes | df=dmy-all }}</ref> Kouyaté was sent-off twice during the 2015–16 season and on both occasions had the card rescinded by [[The Football Association]] (FA). On 21 February, he was dismissed by referee [[Jonathan Moss (referee)|Jonathan Moss]] in a 5–1 [[FA Cup]] win at [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], only for the card to be rescinded a few days later.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35572201 | title=Blackburn 1–5 West Ham United | publisher=BBC Sport | date=21 February 2016 | accessdate=6 April 2016}}</ref><ref name=redcard1>{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/February/23-February/Kouyate-red-card-rescinded | title=Kouyate red card rescinded | publisher=West Ham United F.C. | date=23 February 2016 | accessdate=6 April 2016}}</ref> On 2 April, he was dismissed in a Premier League game at the [[Boleyn Ground]] against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] by referee [[Mark Clattenburg]]. This too, however, was overturned a few days later.<ref name="redcard2">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35970370 | title=West Ham: Cheikhou Kouyate red card rescinded by FA | publisher=BBC Sport | date=5 April 2016 | accessdate=6 April 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== On 4 August 2016, Kouyaté scored West Ham's first ever goal at the [[Olympic Stadium (London)|Olympic Stadium]], coming in the eighth minute of a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] game against [[NK Domžale]]. He also scored the second in the game, which West Ham won 3–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36964415|title=West Ham United 3–0 NK Domzale (agg 4–2)|date=4 August 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 26 October 2016, Kouyaté scored the opening goal in a 2–1 [[EFL Cup]] victory against rivals [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite news|title=West Ham United vs. Chelsea 2–1|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2016/10/26/england/league-cup/west-ham-united-fc/chelsea-football-club/2359878/|accessdate=5 August 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> On 8 April 2017, Kouyaté scored a "stunning low 25-yard strike", as West Ham beat relegation rivals [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39463996|title=West Ham United 1–0 Swansea City|date=8 April 2017|accessdate=5 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== On 23 September 2017, Kouyaté scored his first goal of the season in a 3–2 loss against Tottenham.<ref>{{cite news|title=West Ham United vs. Tottenham Hotspur 2–3|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2017/09/23/england/premier-league/west-ham-united-fc/tottenham-hotspur-football-club/2462853/|accessdate=5 August 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> Kouyaté's final goal for the club came on 24 November 2017, scoring the equaliser in a 1–1 draw with [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=West Ham United vs. Leicester City 1–1|url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2017/11/24/england/premier-league/west-ham-united-fc/leicester-city-fc/2462923/|accessdate=5 August 2018|work=Soccerway}}</ref> Kouyaté marked the headed goal with a lowered crossed-armed celebration, designed to help raise awareness about the [[Slavery in Libya#Slavery in the post-Gaddafi era|ongoing slavery in Libya]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/pogbas-gesture-raises-libya-slave-trade-awareness-100-fold/121l7df5m8hrv1aaoxtgz07a9x|title=Pogba's gesture raises Libya slave trade awareness '100-fold'|date=3 December 2017|accessdate=5 August 2018|publisher=Goal}}</ref>
=== Crystal Palace === On 1 August 2018, Kouyaté completed a move to fellow [[London]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], for an undisclosed fee, believed to be £9.5 million.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/kouyate-signs-for-palace/|title=Kouyate Signs For Palace|website=cpfc.co.uk|access-date=1 August 2018|language=en-gb}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Aarons|first=Ed|title=Crystal Palace sign Cheikhou Kouyaté and close on Swansea's Jordan Ayew|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/01/crystal-palace-cheikhou-kouyate-jordan-ayew|website=theguardian.com|date= 1 August 2018|accessdate=1 November 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Kouyaté was called up aged 18 to the [[Senegal national under-20 football team|Senegal under-20s]] in the same year as his RWDM Brussels debut. He scored two goals in just three games for the side in 2007.
In February 2012, Kouyaté was called up to the [[Senegal national football team|Senegal senior team]]. In the same year, he was announced to be in the squad for [[Senegal national under-23 football team|Senegal Olympic football team]]. He played in every game as Senegal's debut appearance in the [[Olympic Games|tournament]] ended in a knockout in the quarter-final. In January 2015, he was a member of Senegal's squad for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]], held in [[Equatorial Guinea]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20150119/senegal-off-to-the-perfect-start_2236884_4428351 |title=Senegal off to the perfect start |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |accessdate=21 January 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150121061045/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20150119/senegal-off-to-the-perfect-start_2236884_4428351 |archivedate=21 January 2015 |df= }}</ref> Kouyaté is the current Senegalese captain. In May 2018 he was named in Senegal's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad – 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced?|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|website=Goal|accessdate=18 May 2018}}</ref>
