(UTC) }} '''Bakary Sako''' (born 26 April 1988) is a professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as an attacking [[midfielder]] for [[EFL Championship|Premier League club Crystal Palace]] and the [[Mali national football team|Mali national team]].
==Club career== ===Early years=== Sako had been with [[LB Châteauroux|Châteauroux]] since 2001, joining the club as an academy player. He made his league debut on the final matchday of the [[2005-06 Ligue 2|2005–06 Ligue 2 season]] coming on as a half-time substitute in a 4–1 victory over [[SC Bastia|Bastia]].<ref>[http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuilleMatch.asp?saison=2005/2006&code_evt=D2&code_jr_tr=J38&num_ordre=1 Bastia v. Chateauroux Match Report]. Lfp.fr. Retrieved on 29 September 2012.</ref> Following the season, he signed his first professional contract after agreeing to a three-year deal.<ref>[http://www.24sn.com/Embouteillage-en-equipe-nationale_a1368.html Embouteillage en équipe nationale]. 24sn.com. Retrieved on 29 September 2012.</ref> He was promoted to the senior squad and assigned the number 26 shirt.
During the next two seasons, Sako was limited to mostly substitute appearances. He did score his first league goal, during the [[2007–08 Ligue 2|2007–08 season]], in a 1–2 defeat against [[Stade Brest 29|Brest]].<ref>[http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuilleMatch.asp?saison=2007/2008&code_evt=D2&code_jr_tr=J36&num_ordre=5 Chateauroux v. Brest Match Report]. Lfp.fr. Retrieved on 29 September 2012.</ref> During the [[2008–09 Ligue 2|2008–09 season]] Sako became an integral part of the team, helping the club narrowly avoid relegation on the final day.
===Saint-Étienne=== On 9 July 2009, Sako departed Châteauroux for [[Ligue 1]] club [[AS Saint-Étienne]], where he signed a four-year deal for an undisclosed fee.
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== [[File:Bakary Sako.jpg|thumb|left|Sako playing for [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolves]], 2014]]
On 29 August 2012, Sako signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee that was reported to be £2.2 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19409743 |title=Wolves sign Bakary Sako from St Etienne on three-year deal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 August 2012 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref><ref name="pleads for move to Fulham">{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jun/29/wolverhampton-wanderers-bakary-sako-fulham |title=Wolverhampton Wanderers' Bakary Sako pleads for move to Fulham |publisher=The Observer |date=29 June 2013 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> He scored on his Wolves debut in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] tie against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton]] on 30 August 2012,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19352817|title=Northampton 1–3 Wolves|publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2012}}</ref> and again on his league debut in the following match, a 3–1 defeat at [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19384124|title=Cardiff 3–1 Wolves|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 September 2012}}</ref>
The winger adapted well to English football, scoring ten times in total and contributing eleven assists.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/player/_/id/91494/bakary-sako?cc=5739#|title=Bakary Sako|publisher=ESPN}}</ref> However, his season was halted early when he tore his hamstring in March 2013 in a match against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21831205|title=Bakary Sako & Dave Edwards: Wolves await injury diagnosis|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 March 2013}}</ref> which ruled him out for much of the season's final games, during which the team were relegated to League One.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2013/03/25/wolves-trio-carl-ikeme-bakary-sako-and-dave-edwards-ruled-out-for-the-season/|title=Wolves trio Carl Ikeme, Bakary Sako and Dave Edwards ruled out for the season|publisher=Express & Star|date=25 March 2013}}</ref>
Sako was the subject of transfer speculation during Summer 2013 with interest from [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in June 2013 but the London club did not meet a reported £4 million asking price.<ref name="pleads for move to Fulham"/> Owing to his uncertain future, the player did not play in Wolves' final match of the transfer window as he "didn't feel he was in the right frame of mind".<ref name="Forest bid">{{cite web|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2013/09/01/wolves-turn-down-nottingham-forest-bakary-sako-bid/|title=Wolves turn down Nottingham Forest Bakary Sako bid|publisher=Express & Star|date=1 September 2013}}</ref> Several reported bids from [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] were rejected by the club.<ref name="Forest bid"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.shropshirestar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2013/09/03/wolves-reject-3-5m-bid-for-bakary-sako/?|title=Wolves reject £3.5m bid for Bakary Sako|publisher=Shropshire Star|date=3 September 2013}}</ref> In October 2013, Forest again attempted to set up a deal but Wolves pulled out of negotiations citing that "the terms surrounding the offer were unrealistic".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/club-statement-bakary-sako-041013-1094696.aspx|title=Club Statement: Bakary Sako|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=4 October 2013|access-date=4 October 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004111816/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/club-statement-bakary-sako-041013-1094696.aspx#|archive-date=4 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Despite the initial speculation surrounding his future and the breakdown of his proposed move to Forest, Sako went on to have a productive season for Wolves, finishing as joint top-scorer alongside the departed [[Leigh Griffiths]] as Wolves won the [[EFL League One|League One]] title with a record points haul for the third tier. Sako was also named in the League One [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the 2013–14 season alongside four of his teammates.<ref name=PFATOTY1314>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27180793 |title=Luis Suarez: Liverpool striker wins PFA Player of the Year award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=7 May 2018}}</ref>
Back at Championship level, Sako continued to score regularly for Wolves and was named in the Championship PFA Team of the Year for the 2014–15 season.<ref name=PFATOTY1415>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32473770 |title=PFA Championship Team of the Year: Deeney only Watford player |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=7 May 2018}}</ref> He finished the season as the club's (joint) top goalscorer as the team missed out on the play-offs on goal difference. Out of contract with the club, he voiced his desire to play in the Premier League,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/club-statement-bakary-sako-041013-1094696.aspx|title=Sako thanks for support|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=4 May 2015|access-date=4 October 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004111816/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/club-statement-bakary-sako-041013-1094696.aspx#|archive-date=4 October 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> while head coach Kenny Jackett stated that he expected Sako to depart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/gaffer-expects-sako-to-move-on-2436574.aspx|title=Gaffer expects Sako to move on|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=2 May 2015|access-date=31 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304062105/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/gaffer-expects-sako-to-move-on-2436574.aspx#|archive-date=4 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Crystal Palace=== On 5 August 2015, Sako joined [[Premier League]] side [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on a three-year contract following his release from Wolves.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sako Signs Eagles Deal|date=5 August 2015|website=cpfc.co.uk|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/august/sako-signs-eagles-deal/|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on his full debut against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 22 August 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Crystal Palace 2–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33944695|accessdate=27 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 August 2015}}</ref> Sako then scored again the following week away to Chelsea, in a 2–1 win, which was [[José Mourinho]]'s second ever loss at Stamford Bridge. Sako also assisted the second goal scored by [[Joel Ward (footballer)|Joel Ward]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ronay|first1=Barney|title=Chelsea humbled at home after Sako and Ward strike for Crystal Palace|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/29/chelsea-crystal-palace-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=19 January 2018|work=The Guardian|date=29 August 2015}}</ref>
In the 2017–18 season, Sako's form started to pick up under the management of [[Roy Hodgson]] scoring his first goal of the season against Huddersfield in the [[EFL Cup]]. He later scored against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] in the same competition. Sako was also back scoring in the league as well, netting against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] and [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester]]. He also added a goal in the [[FA Cup]] in an away loss to [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=McInnes|first1=Paul|title=Crystal Palace revival continues as Bakary Sako strikes against Burnley|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/13/crystal-palace-burnley-premier-league-report|accessdate=19 January 2018|work=The Guardian|date=13 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Return of the Bak: How Bakary Sako Resurrected His Crystal Palace Career|url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/01/15/return-bak-how-bakary-sako-resurrected-his-crystal-palace-career|accessdate=19 January 2018|work=Sports Illustrated|date=15 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Lea|first1=Greg|title=How Bakary Sako Went From Bit-Part Player To Guaranteed Starter – And Top Scorer – At Crystal Palace|url=https://www.thesportsman.com/articles/how-bakary-sako-went-from-bit-part-player-to-guaranteed-starter-and-top-scorer-at-crystal-palace|accessdate=19 January 2018|work=The Sportsman|date=16 January 2018}}</ref>
===West Bromwich Albion=== On 2 October 2018, [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] signed free agent Sako until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sako signs for the Baggies|date=2 October 2018|website=West brom official site|url=https://www.wba.co.uk/news/2018/october/sako-signs-for-the-baggies//|accessdate=2 October 2018}}</ref>
===Return to Crystal Palace=== On 27 January 2019, Sako rejoined [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on a short-term contract until the end of the 2018–19 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2019/january/bakary-sako-returns-to-palace-on-short-term-deal/|title=Bakary Sako has rejoined Crystal Palace until the end of the season|website=cpfc.co.uk|date=27 January 2019|accessdate=27 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== Sako played for the [[Mali national under-17 football team|Malian U17 team]] in one friendly match in 2005, while the team was preparing for the [[2005 African Under-17 Championship]]. The following year, he returned to the [[France national youth football team|French team]] playing with the [[France national youth football team#France national under-18 squad|under-18 squad]]. He was a member of the French squad that participated in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2007 European Under-19 Championship]] reaching the semi-finals before being eliminated by [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. He made his [[France national under-21 football team|French under-21]] debut on 11 February 2009 in a [[Exhibition match|friendly match]] against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]]. He scored his first under-21 goal in the [[2009 Toulon Tournament]] against [[Qatar national football team|Qatar]].
===Senior=== [[File:20150331 Mali vs Ghana 063.jpg|thumb|Bakary Sako during [[Mali national football team|Mali]]-[[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] in March 2015.]] Sako was called up by the [[Mali national football team|Malian national team]] for the first time for a friendly against [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] on 5 March 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mali call-up for Wolves winger Bakary Sako|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2014/02/28/mali-call-up-for-wolves-winger-bakary-sako/|publisher=Express and Star |date=28 February 2014}}</ref> He scored his first international goal against [[Guinea national football team|Guinea]] in a friendly match played in [[Colombes]], France, on 25 May 2014.<ref>[http://www.national-football-teams.com/matches/report/10596/Mali_Guinea.html Mali vs. Guinea (1:2)]. National Football Teams (27 April 2015). Retrieved 12 May 2015.</ref> His first goal in competitive internationals came when he scored the opener in a 2–0 win over [[Malawi national football team|Malawi]] in an [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations qualification#Group B|Africa Cup of Nations qualification]] match played in [[Bamako]] on 7 September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ten-man Mali hold on to defeat Malawi in Afcon qualifier |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29103857 |publisher=BBC |date=7 September 2014}}</ref><ref>[http://www.national-football-teams.com/player/54821/Bakary_Sako.html Bakary Sako]. National Football Teams. Retrieved on 12 May 2015.</ref> In December 2014 Sako was called up to the Mali squad for the finals of the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] to be held in [[Equatorial Guinea]] in January 2015. This was to be his first taste of a senior international tournament.
Sako started Mali's first two matches in group D of the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] in [[Equatorial Guinea]]. These both finished in 1–1 draws, against [[Cameroon]] on 20 January and against [[Ivory Coast]] on 24 January. Sako scored a left-foot half-volley against Ivory Coast that the BBC hailed as the goal of the tournament at that point. Sako was unable to start the final and decisive group game against [[Guinea]] due to an illness though he did appear from the bench for the final 15 minutes of the game. This too ended in a 1–1 stalemate, meaning that five of the six games in group D finished 1–1 and this led to the drawing of lots between Mali and Guinea to decide who qualified for the quarter finals and who went home. It was Guinea who emerged from the hat, meaning the Eagles exited the tournament unbeaten.

{{spanish name|Guaita|Panadero}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Vicente Guaita | image = Vicente Guaita.jpg | image_size = | caption = Guaita as a [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] player in 2009 | fullname = Vicente Guaita Panadero{{cite web|url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/vicente-guaita-panadero/62971/|title=Guaita: Summary|website=Soccerway|publisher=Perform Group|accessdate=10 June 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|1|10|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Torrent, Valencia|Torrent]], Spain | height = 1.90 m | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | clubnumber = 31 | youthyears1 = 1995–2000 | youthclubs1 = Monte-Sión | youthyears2 = 2000–2006 | youthclubs2 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | years1 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = [[Valencia CF Mestalla|Valencia Mestalla]] | caps1 = 18 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2008–2014 | clubs2 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | caps2 = 76 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2009–2010 | clubs3 = → [[Recreativo de Huelva|Recreativo]] (loan) | caps3 = 30 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2014–2018 | clubs4 = [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] | caps4 = 108 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps5 = 12 | goals5 = 0 | totalcaps = | totalgoals = | club-update = 17:09, 9 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Vicente Guaita Panadero''' ({{IPA-es|biˈθente ˈɣwaita panaˈðeɾo}};{{efn-lr|In isolation, ''Guaita'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|ˈɡwaita|}}.}} born 10 January 1987) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|CrystalP}} club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. He appeared in 176 [[La Liga]] matches during eight seasons with [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] and [[Getafe CF|Getafe]], as well as a season on loan with [[Recreativo de Huelva|Recreativo]] in the [[Segunda División]]. ==Club career== ===Valencia=== Born in [[Torrent, Valencia|Torrent]], [[Valencian Community]],{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/joan-carles-marti/2011/06/02/der-guaita-nacido-parar/129415.html|title=Van der Guaita, nacido para parar|trans-title=Van der Guaita, born to stop|newspaper=[[Super Deporte]]|first=Joan Carles|last=Martí|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=28 May 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} Guaita graduated from the [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] youth system after arriving there from CD Monte-sión at the age of 13,{{cite news|url=http://www.publico.es/actualidad/guaita-portero-del-valencia-dice.html|title=Guaita, portero del Valencia, dice que debe seguir apretando para que no le quiten lo que {{sic|nolink=y|tienen}} ahora|trans-title=Guaita, Valencia goalkeeper, says he must keep pushing so that they do not take him what he has now|newspaper=[[Público (Spain)|Público]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=31 May 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} being promoted to the first team for the [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09 season]] following the retirement of longtime incumbent [[Santiago Cañizares]]. Additionally, as German [[Timo Hildebrand]] became ostracized by coach [[Unai Emery]], he became the backup.{{cite news|url=https://as.com/futbol/2008/10/13/mas_futbol/1223879212_850215.html|title="Sería un orgullo seguir a Sempere o Palop"|trans-title="I would be proud to follow on Sempere or Palop's footsteps"|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|first=M.|last=Gimeno|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=13 October 2008|accessdate=12 June 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://cadenaser.com/ser/2008/10/28/deportes/1225153695_850215.html|title=Emery: "Me da vergüenza ajena que el Madrid se queje de los árbitros"|trans-title=Emery: "I find it shameful that Madrid complain about refereeing"|publisher=[[Cadena SER]]|language=Spanish|date=28 October 2008|accessdate=12 June 2018}} Guaita made his official debut with the main squad on 2 October 2008, in a [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] tie against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] ([[2008–09 UEFA Cup|2–1 home win]]).{{cite news|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2008/10/03/mas_futbol/1222984801_850215.html|title=El Valencia se clasifica sufriendo|trans-title=Valencia go through suffering|newspaper=Diario AS|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=3 October 2008|accessdate=4 March 2014}} However, after the signing of veteran [[César Sánchez]] from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] later in the year and the full recovery of [[Renan Brito Soares|Renan]], he remained third-choice until the end of the campaign.{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/deportes/2010/12/03/actualidad/1291364519_850215.html|title=El examen tranquilo de Guaita|trans-title=Guaita's peaceful test|newspaper=[[El País]]|first=Rosa|last=Sulleiro|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=3 December 2010|accessdate=12 June 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.lasprovincias.es/20130227/deportes/valencia/cesar-guaita-valencia-mejor-201302271637.html|title=César: "Guaita es el portero con más condiciones del fútbol español"|trans-title=César: «No goalkeeper in Spanish football is more blessed than Guaita»|newspaper=[[Las Provincias]]|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=27 February 2013|accessdate=12 June 2018}} In [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10]], with Sánchez having renewed his link a further year and the signing of [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]]'s [[Miguel Ángel Moyá]], Guaita was deemed surplus to requirements and joined, on loan, [[Segunda División]]'s [[Recreativo de Huelva]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hortanoticias.com/noticia/373868/Torrent/guardameta-vicente-guaita-jugar%C3%A1-cedido-valencia-cf-recreativo-huelva.html|title=El guardameta Vicente Guaita jugará cedido por el Valencia CF en el Recreativo de Huelva|trans-title=Goalkeeper Vicente Guaita will play with Recreativo de Huelva on loan from Valencia CF|publisher=Horta Noticias|language=Spanish|date=24 August 2009|accessdate=22 January 2013|dead-url=yes|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130216053550/http://www.hortanoticias.com/noticia/373868/Torrent/guardameta-vicente-guaita-jugar%C3%A1-cedido-valencia-cf-recreativo-huelva.html|archive-date=16 February 2013|df=dmy-all}} As the [[Andalusia]]ns [[2009–10 Segunda División|finished comfortably in mid-table]] he was awarded the competition's [[Ricardo Zamora Trophy]], with just 24 goals conceded in 30 appearances.{{cite web|url=http://huelva.eldesmarque.com/recreativo/22495-guaita-ya-es-el-zamora-de-la-categoria|title=Guaita ya es el Zamora de la Segunda División|trans-title=Guaita is already the Zamora in ''Segunda División''|publisher=El Desmarque|first=Álvaro|last=Ramírez|language=Spanish|date=13 June 2010|accessdate=12 January 2018}} In November–December 2010, profiting from injuries to both César and Moyà, Guaita had a run of several matches for Valencia, notably a 2–1 home win against [[UD Almería|Almería]] in [[La Liga]]{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/301980/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Soldado at the double for Valencia|website=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=28 November 2010|accessdate=22 January 2013}} and a [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|1–1 draw]] away to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for the [[UEFA Champions League]].{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/307806/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Anderson makes precious point|website=ESPN Soccernet|date=7 December 2010|accessdate=22 January 2013}} On 2 April 2011, as he had established himself in the starting XI, he suffered the loss of his father due to a heart attack (aged only 46),{{cite web|url=http://vcfcentral.com/latest-news/mata-we-scored-quickly-and-that-gave-us-confidence/|title=Mata: We scored quickly, and that gave us confidence|website=VCF Central|date=4 April 2011|accessdate=10 April 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322134448/http://vcfcentral.com/latest-news/mata-we-scored-quickly-and-that-gave-us-confidence/|archivedate=22 March 2012}} prompting manager Emery to reinstate César between the posts for two games.{{cite news|url=http://ecodiario.eleconomista.es/futbol/noticias/2959026/04/11/Cesar-se-convierte-en-el-portero-con-mas-edad-que-juega-en-Primera.html|title=César se convierte en el portero con más edad que juega en Primera|trans-title=César becomes oldest goalkeeper to play in ''Primera''|newspaper=[[El Economista (Spain)|El Economista]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=2 April 2011|accessdate=12 June 2018}} In May 2011, Guaita extended his contract with Valencia until 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/valencia/2011/05/31/guaita-queria-familia-anos-posibles/129684.html|title=Guaita: 'Tenía claro que quería quedarme en el VCF'|trans-title=Guaita: 'I was sure i wanted to stay with VCF'|newspaper=Super Deporte|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=31 May 2011|accessdate=31 May 2011}} He begun [[2011–12 La Liga|the season]] as the starter, but picked up a serious hand injury in early November 2011, being nonetheless selected to several games by Emery as the reserve.{{cite news|url=http://www.superdeporte.es/valencia/2011/12/21/mano-vuelve-frenar-guaita/148219.html|title=La mano vuelve a frenar a Guaita|trans-title=Hand stops Guaita again|newspaper=Super Deporte|location=Valencia|language=Spanish|date=21 December 2011|accessdate=26 January 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2012/01/04/futbol/equipos/valencia/1325669207.html|title=Guaita sólo para emergencias|trans-title=Guaita for emergencies only|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=D.|last=Picó|first2=D.|last2=Puig|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=4 January 2012|accessdate=26 January 2012}} ===Getafe=== [[File:Vicente Guaita.png|thumb|upright|Guaita in 2016]] On 31 July 2014, Guaita was sold to [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] with a buy-back option.{{cite web|url=http://www.valenciacf.com/ver/36608/comunicado-oficial---traspaso-de-vicente-guaita-al-getafe-cf-.html|title=Comunicado oficial – Traspaso de Vicente Guaita al Getafe CF|trans-title=Official announcement – Transfer of Vicente Guaita to Getafe CF|publisher=Valencia CF|language=Spanish|date=31 July 2014|accessdate=31 July 2014}} He made his debut for his new team on 24 August, in a 1–3 away loss to [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta]].{{cite web|url=http://espanol.eurosport.com/futbol/liga/2014-2015/en-vivo-celta-getafe-2100_sto4371941/story.shtml|title=Celta-Getafe: El mejor tridente para empezar (3–1)|trans-title=Celta-Getafe: The best trio to start (3–1)|publisher=[[Eurosport]]|language=Spanish|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=28 July 2017}} In the [[2016–17 Segunda División|2016–17 campaign]], with the club again in the second level, Guaita played little due to injury.{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/getafe/2016/09/27/57ea990f268e3e61298b4615.html|title=Guaita estará un mes y medio de baja por una lesión en la muñeca|trans-title=Guaita will be out for one and a half months due to a wrist injury|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=27 September 2016|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vavel.com/es/futbol/getafe-cf/792683-guaita-es-el-todo-u-otra-temporada-en-segunda.html|title=Guaita: "Es el todo u otra temporada en Segunda"|trans-title=Guaita: "Anything goes or another season in ''Segunda'' it is"|publisher=[[Vavel]]|first=Elena María|last=Pintado Nieto|language=Spanish|date=25 May 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}} He was, however, the starter in [[2017 Segunda División play-offs|the play-offs]], which ended in promotion.{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/segunda-division/2017/06/14/5941a291ca4741df0d8b460b.html|title=El Huesca no se rinde y levanta dos goles para soñar con la final|trans-title=Huesca do not surrender and come back from two goals to dream with final|newspaper=Marca|first=Juancar|last=Navacerrada|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=14 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/segunda-division/2017/06/17/59459713ca474116058b4613.html|title=El Getafe arrasa al Huesca y está en la final|trans-title=Getafe destroy Huesca and are already in the final|newspaper=Marca|first=Juancar|last=Navacerrada|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=17 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://www.20minutos.es/deportes/noticia/tenerife-gana-getafe-partido-ida-ascenso-primera-3071429/0/|title=El Tenerife da el primer paso hacia el ascenso al derrotar al Getafe en la ida con gol de Jorge|trans-title=Tenerife take first step towards promotion after defeating Getafe in first leg with goal from Jorge|newspaper=[[20 minutos]]|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=22 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/deportes/2017/06/24/actualidad/1498332522_361003.html|title=El Getafe regresa a Primera tras ganar al Tenerife (3–1)|trans-title=Getafe return to ''Primera'' after beating Tenerife (3–1)|newspaper=El País|first=Ladislao J.|last=Moñino|location=Madrid|language=Spanish|date=24 June 2017|accessdate=12 January 2018}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 2 February 2018, [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] manager [[Roy Hodgson]] confirmed Guaita had agreed to join from 1 July on a [[Free transfer (association football)|free transfer]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/02/football-crystal-palace-getafe-vicente-guaita-goalkeeper|title=Crystal Palace to sign Getafe goalkeeper Vicente Guaita in July|first=Dominic|last=Fifield|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|location=London|date=2 February 2018|accessdate=10 June 2018}} The transfer was reconfirmed by the club on 8 June, with the player joining on a three-year contract.{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/june/vicente-guaita-to-join-palace-on-1st-july/|title=Vicente Guaita to join Palace on 1st July|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.|date=8 June 2018|accessdate=10 June 2018}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut on 15 December, keeping a [[Shutout#Association football|clean sheet]] in a 1–0 home win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46491854|title=Crystal Palace 1–0 Leicester City|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Jack|last=Skelton|date=15 December 2018|accessdate=22 December 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 16 March 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ national under-17 football team|England U17]]| nationalcaps2 = 8| nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 22:09, 28 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Ryan Stuart Clayton Inniss''' (born 5 June 1995) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|centre back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].
An [[England national under-16 football team|England under-16]] and [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]] international, he turned professional at Crystal Palace in 2011. He had a number of loan spells at [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]], [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]], [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]], [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]], [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]], [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]], [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] and [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]].
==Club career== ===Crystal Palace=== Inniss joined the [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] youth academy at the age of 14 and signed his first professional contract two years later.<ref name="TalkSport">{{cite web |url=http://talksport.com/magazine/features/121104/three-crystal-palace-kids-could-attract-premier-league-clubs-victor-mose-184267 |title= Three Crystal Palace kids that could attract Premier League clubs like Victor Moses and Wilfried Zaha |publisher=Talksport |date=4 November 2012| accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref> He captained the club's youth team during the 2012–13 season.<ref name="hat">{{cite news |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/luton-town/hatters-sign-palace-defender-on-loan-1-5800609|title=Hatters sign Palace defender on loan |publisher=Luton Today |date=10 January 2014 |accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref>
Inniss joined [[EFL League Two|League Two]] side [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]] on 1 August 2013 on a month's loan;<ref name="pal">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23531301 |title=Ryan Inniss: Crystal Palace defender joins Cheltenham Town |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 August 2013 |accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> this was later extended for a further month.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/8904288/inniss-extends-robins-stay |title=Inniss extends Robins stay |publisher=Sky Sports |date=3 September 2013 |accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> "Robins" manager [[Mark Yates (footballer)|Mark Yates]] said that Inniss had "been on our radar for six months now".<ref name="pal"/> Standing in for the injured [[Troy Brown (footballer)|Troy Brown]], Inniss made his professional debut on 27 August 2013 in Cheltenham's 2–1 [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] defeat against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He impressed, despite suffering a facial injury.<ref name="STEVE Elliott">{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisgloucestershire.co.uk/Cheltenham-Town-video-Inniss-enjoy-big-future/story-19728489-detail/story.html |title=Cheltenham Town video: Inniss can enjoy big future at highest level – Elliott |newspaper=Gloucestershire Echo |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> He made his first appearance in the [[English Football League]] four days later against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].<ref>{{Soccerbase season|64833|2013|name=Ryan Inniss|access-date=8 September 2013}}</ref> On 13 September 2013, Inniss had his loan spell at Cheltenham terminated due to injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ctfc.com/news/article/wilson-in-inniss-out-1050176.aspx|title=Wilson in, Inniss out |publisher=Cheltenham Town F.C. |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref> After recovering, he was an unused substitute for Crystal Palace in a 3–1 loss to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the [[Premier League]] on 5 October 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24350200 |title=Liverpool 3–1 Crystal Palace |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 October 2013 |accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref>
On 10 January 2014, Inniss joined [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] leaders [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] on a one-month loan, having been a "number one target" for "Hatters" manager [[John Still (footballer)|John Still]].<ref name="hat"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/article/inniss-signs-100114-1285815.aspx|title=Hatters loan Palace's Inniss |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=10 January 2014 |accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref> He scored with his first touch five minutes into his Luton debut in a 2–2 [[FA Trophy]] draw with [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/luton-town/hatters-denied-trophy-victory-by-cambridge-united-fightback-1-5802450|title=Hatters denied Trophy victory by Cambridge United fightback |work=Luton Today |publisher=Johnston Publishing Ltd. |date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=12 January 2014}}</ref> He returned to Crystal Palace after playing in three matches for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/luton-town/luton-loan-man-inniss-returns-to-crystal-palace-1-5872434|title=Luton loan man Inniss returns to Crystal Palace|work=Luton Today |publisher=Johnston Publishing Ltd. |date=12 February 2014 |accessdate=12 February 2014}}</ref> On 14 February 2014, he joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] on a loan deal lasting until the end of the season,<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ryan Inniss Joins Gillingham |url=http://www.gillinghamfootballclub.com/news/article/ryan-inniss-joins-gillingham-1358978.aspx |work=Gillingham FC |date=14 February 2014}}</ref> making his debut against [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] in a 1–0 defeat. He picked up an injury in the game, which limited him to just two further appearances for the "Gills".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cawdell|first1=Luke|title=On-loan Crystal Palace defender Ryan Inniss hoping for Gillingham starting spot against Rotherham|url=http://www.kentonline.co.uk/kent/sport/inniss-pushing-for-recall-15066/|accessdate=13 February 2015|work=Kent Online|date=31 March 2014}}</ref>
On 16 October 2014, Inniss joined [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on a one-month loan deal,<ref name="Tony Pulis">{{cite news |title=Ryan Inniss: Crystal Palace defender signs for Yeovil Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29649996 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 October 2014 |accessdate=16 October 2014}}</ref> later extended until 20 December 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30083289 |title=Ryan Inniss: Yeovil Town extend Crystal Palace defender's loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 November 2014 |accessdate=17 November 2014 }}</ref> "Glovers" manager [[Gary Johnson (footballer, born 1955)|Gary Johnson]] had signed him on the recommendation of [[Tony Pulis]].<ref name="Tony Pulis"/> On 29 November, he was sent off for the first time in his career for a two-footed challenge on [[Kyel Reid]] in a 2–0 defeat by [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] at [[Huish Park]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Yeovil Town 0-2 Preston North End|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30156289|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=29 November 2014}}</ref> On 6 January 2015, Inniss returned to Crystal Palace after being recalled from his loan spell at Yeovil having made six appearances.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30700563 |title=Ryan Inniss recalled by Crystal Palace from Yeovil loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 January 2015 |accessdate=6 January 2015 }}</ref>
On 12 February 2015, Inniss joined [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] on a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ryan Inniss: Port Vale sign Crystal Palace defender on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31444488|accessdate=13 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=12 February 2015}}</ref> He made his debut two days later, helping the "Valiants" to keep their first clean sheet in three months with a 1–0 win over [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Walsall 0-1 Port Vale match report: Superb Vale stun Saddlers|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Walsall-Port-Vale-match-report/story-26026555-detail/story.html|accessdate=14 February 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=14 February 2015}}</ref> He collected five yellow cards in five starts during his stay at [[Vale Park]], helping the team to concede just two goals whilst he was on the pitch, but his loan spell was not extended as he damaged his ankle ligaments during his final appearance.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Injured Ryan Inniss 'unlikely' to return to Vale this season|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=9 March 2015}}</ref>
After being linked with a return to [[Burslem]] for many weeks, his arrival on loan at Port Vale for the entirety of the [[2015–16 Port Vale F.C. season|2015–16]] season was confirmed on 27 July.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ryan Inniss: Port Vale sign Crystal Palace defender on season's loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33676058|accessdate=27 July 2015|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=27 July 2015}}</ref> He started the [[2015–16 Port Vale F.C. season|2015–16]] season competing with [[Remie Streete]] and [[Richard Duffy]] for one of two available centre-back places.<ref>{{cite news|title=Competition keeps us on our toes, says defender Ryan Inniss|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale/story-27618343-detail/story.html|accessdate=17 August 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=17 August 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150818125136/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale/story-27618343-detail/story.html|archivedate=18 August 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was in good form at the start of the campaign, and also managed to significantly improve his disciplinary record.<ref>{{cite news|title=Record highlights defender's improvement, says boss Rob Page |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Page-Record-highlights-defender-s-improvement/story-27768354-detail/story.html|accessdate=10 September 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=10 September 2015}}</ref> He dislocated his shoulder in September and returned to [[Selhurst Park]] for treatment, though his loan deal to Port Vale remained active.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Ryan Inniss back at Crystal Palace with shoulder injury |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Ryan-Inniss-Crystal-Palace-treatment/story-27882177-detail/story.html|accessdate=28 September 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=28 September 2015}}</ref> He returned to Vale shortly after Christmas.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Port Vale: Ryan Inniss returns to Valiants|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Ryan-Inniss-returns-Valiants/story-28425208-detail/story.html|accessdate=27 December 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=26 December 2015}}</ref> However he picked up a hamstring injury in a home draw with [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on 7 February, and was ruled out of action for three weeks.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Ryan Inniss out of action but escapes lengthy lay off|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-news-Ryan-Inniss-action-escapes-lengthy/story-28716861-detail/story.html|accessdate=11 February 2016|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=11 February 2016}}</ref> He returned to Crystal Palace after a re-occurrence of his hamstring injury in a defeat to [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 28 March.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Port Vale's Crystal Palace loan player Ryan Inniss is ruled out for rest of season |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-s-Crystal-Palace-loan-player-Ryan/story-29026870-detail/story.html|accessdate=31 March 2016|work=The Sentinel|date=31 March 2016}}</ref> Page described him as "the unluckiest player I think I have ever met with injuries".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=On-loan Crystal Palace youngster Ryan Inniss suffers hamstring injury |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-loan-Crystal-Palace-youngster-Ryan/story-29007888-detail/story.html|accessdate=28 March 2016|work=The Sentinel|date=28 March 2016}}</ref>
On 31 August 2016, he joined League One side [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] on loan for the rest of the [[2016–17 Southend United F.C. season|2016–17]] season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ryan Inniss: Crystal Palace defender joins Southend United on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37238733|accessdate=31 August 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=31 August 2016}}</ref> He had a difficult start to the campaign, and after returning to Southend following his release from prison he went on to dislocate his shoulder in an [[FA Cup]] defeat to [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], and was ruled out of action for three months following surgery.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ryan Inniss: Southend United defender has shoulder surgery|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37937804|accessdate=12 November 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=10 November 2016}}</ref> On 25 February, he was sent off for two yellow card offences in a 2–1 loss at [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]], though manager [[Phil Brown (footballer, born 1959)|Phil Brown]] strongly criticised the decision and said it was "unbelievable refereeing".<ref>{{cite news|title=Phil Brown: Southend boss says referee should be 'brought to task' over performance|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39106998|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=27 February 2017}}</ref> On 4 April, he dislocated his shoulder for the second time of the season in a 1–0 defeat to Bolton Wanderers at [[Roots Hall]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Phillisp|first1=Chris|title=On loan defender Inniss suffers dislocated shoulder during Blues' defeat to Bolton|url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/sport/blues/15203420.On_loan_defender_Inniss_suffers_dislocated_shoulder_during_Blues__defeat_to_Bolton/|accessdate=5 April 2017|work=Southend Echo|date=5 April 2017|language=en}}</ref>
On 31 August 2017, he joined League Two side [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] on loan for the rest of the [[2017–18 Colchester United F.C. season|2017–18]] season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cu-fc.com/news/2017/august/us-flash-inniss-added-to-defence/|title=U's Flash:Inniss Added To Defence|website=www.cu-fc.com|date=31 August 2017}}</ref> He made his Colchester debut in a 3–1 win over [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]] at the [[Colchester Community Stadium]] on 9 September.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133111 |title=Colchester United 3–1 Crawley Town |date=9 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=9 September 2017 }}</ref> He made 19 appearances for [[John McGreal]]'s "U's" across the [[2017–18 Colchester United F.C. season|2017–18]] season.
Inniss made his Crystal Palace debut on 28 August 2018, playing in the entirety of the club's 1–0 win at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in the [[EFL Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Swansea City 0-1 Crystal Palace: Alexander Sorloth sends Eagles through |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45254463 |accessdate=1 September 2018 |work=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2018}}</ref> Hr admitted his "surprise" at finally making his senior debut for the club and said "I can only thank those people at the club who have helped me off the field through some tough times".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Warlow |first1=Robert |title=Palace defender reflects on his debut after off-field troubles |url=https://www.football.london/crystal-palace-fc/players/ryan-inniss-opens-up-troubles-15085314 |accessdate=3 February 2019 |work=footballlondon |date=29 August 2018}}</ref> However manager [[Roy Hodgson]] he did not name him in his 25-man Premier League squad,<ref>{{cite news |last1=Thorogood |first1=Tom |title=Roy Hodgson admits Ryan Inniss is likely to depart Crystal Palace |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2018/08/31/tt-crystal-palace-boss-admits-ryan-inniss-is-likely-to-depart-cl/ |accessdate=1 September 2018 |work=Here Is The City |date=1 September 2018 |language=en}}</ref> and three days later he joined [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] on loan until the end of the [[2018–19 Dundee F.C. season|2018–19]] season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Inniss Loaned to Dundee|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/inniss-loaned-to-dundee/|website=cpfc.co.uk|date=1 September 2018|accessdate=1 September 2018}}</ref> He started the season in the "Dens" starting eleven, but fell out of the first-team picture after [[Jim McIntyre (footballer)|Jim McIntyre]] replaced [[Neil McCann]] as manager in October.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cran |first1=George |title=No sulking for Ryan Inniss as he plots Dundee return |url=https://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/fp/no-sulking-for-ryan-inniss-as-he-plots-dundee-return/ |accessdate=3 February 2019 |work=Evening Telegraph |date=7 January 2019}}</ref> He did manage to force his way back into the team in January, alongside [[Genséric Kusunga]], after [[Darren O'Dea]] was suspended and [[Andrew Davies (footballer)|Andrew Davies]] picked up an injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Dundee boss Jim McIntyre reveals defender played on Saturday despite being ill all week |url=https://www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/sport/football/dundee-fc/811969/dundee-boss-jim-mcintyre-reveals-defender-played-on-saturday-despite-being-ill-all-week/ |accessdate=3 February 2019 |work=The Courier |date=22 January 2019}}</ref> However his loan at [[Dens Park]] was ended early on 31 January, with Inniss returning to Palace having played 13 games for Dundee.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/fp/dundees-ryan-inniss-resturns-to-crystal-palace/|title=Dundee's Ryan Inniss returns to Crystal Palace|work=Evening Telegraph|access-date=1 February 2019|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}}</ref>
==International career== Inniss has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]] and [[England national under-17 football team|under-17 level]].<ref name="EnglandYouth">{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players/I/Ryan-Inniss |title=Ryan Inniss |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> He scored the winning goal in England U16's 2–1 [[Victory Shield]] win over [[Scotland national under-16 football team|Scotland U16]] in 2011.<ref name=EnglandYouth/>
Inniss is eligible to represent [[Trinidad and Tobago]] at international level, due to his father being born there.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Ryan Inniss could follow Chris Birchall into Trinidad and Tobago team|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Ryan-Inniss-copuld-follow-Chris/story-26094987-detail/story.html|accessdate=28 February 2015|work=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]]|date=28 February 2015}}</ref>
==Personal life== Inniss had a troubled childhood, as his mother's drug dependency and his father's imprisonment left him to raise his two younger siblings as a teenager.<ref name="last chance">{{cite news|last1=Booker|first1=James|title=Ryan Inniss 'on last chance' says Palace chief Steve Parish|url=http://www.croydonadvertiser.co.uk/ryan-inniss-on-last-chance-says-crystal-palace-chief-steve-parish/story-29707576-detail/story.html|accessdate=12 September 2016|work=Croydon Advertiser|date=12 September 2016}}</ref> He has three police cautions: one for a public order offence in 2011, one for common assault in August 2015 and one for being drunk and disorderly and resisting a police constable in March 2015.<ref name="last chance"/> On 9 September 2016, Inniss pleaded guilty to assault following an incident in a bar four months earlier; he was sentenced to 14 weeks in prison.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Burnett|first1=Tom|title=Former Vale star jailed for assault|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/crystal-palace-defender-ryan-inniss-who-made-15-appearances-for-port-vale-sent-to-prison/story-29701862-detail/story.html|accessdate=9 September 2016|work=The Sentinel|date=9 September 2016}}</ref> He was released three days later after successfully appealing his sentence, which was suspended for 18 months; he was also handed 240 hours unpaid work, a £300 fine, and ordered to take part in a 20-day alcohol rehabilitation course.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Ex Port Vale loan ace Ryan Inniss wins appeal against sentence|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/former-port-vale-loan-defender-ryan-inniss-wins-appeal-against-prison-sentence/story-29707920-detail/story.html?812|accessdate=12 September 2016|work=The Sentinel|date=12 September 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== A vocal player, [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]] centre-back partner [[Steve Elliott (footballer, born 1978)|Steve Elliott]] described him as "a typical modern-day centre-half: tall, athletic and aggressive".<ref name="STEVE Elliott"/>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 26 January 2019}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox football biography | name = Alexander Sørloth | image = Alexander Sørloth.JPG | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Alexander Sørloth{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|12|5|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Trondheim]], Norway | height = 1.94 m | position = [[Striker (association football)|Striker]] | currentclub = [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Strindheim]] | youthyears2 = | youthclubs2 = [[Rosenborg BK|Rosenborg]] | years1 = 2012–2015 | clubs1 = [[Rosenborg BK 2|Rosenborg 2]] | caps1 = 46 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2013–2015 | clubs2 = [[Rosenborg BK|Rosenborg]] | caps2 = 6 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = → [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]] (loan) | caps3 = 26 | goals3 = 13 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = [[FC Groningen]] | caps4 = 38 | goals4 = 5 | years5 = 2017–2018 | clubs5 = [[FC Midtjylland]] | caps5 = 19 | goals5 = 10 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps6 = 16 | goals6 = 0 | clubs7 = → [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] (loan) | years7 = 2019– | caps7 = 8 | goals7 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = Norway U16 | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Norway national under-17 football team|Norway U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013 | nationalteam3 = Norway U18 | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 5 | nationalyears4 = 2014 | nationalteam4 = [[Norway national under-19 football team|Norway U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam5 = [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[Norway national football team|Norway]] | nationalcaps6 = 17 | nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 2 March 2019 | nationalteam-update = 19 November 2018 }} '''Alexander Sørloth''' (born 5 December 1995) is a Norwegian [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (Association football)|striker]] for [[K.A.A. Gent]] on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], and for the [[Norway national football team|Norway national team]]. ==Career== ===Rosenborg=== After several years in the youth system Sørloth was rewarded with a contract by Rosenborg in July 2013. He played his first professional game for Rosenborg when he was subbed on in the second half of the [[2013-14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] first qualifying round game versus [[Crusaders FC|Crusaders]], and it took him only 12 minutes to score his first goal, Rosenborg's 6th in their 7–2 win. He made his debut in the [[Tippeligaen]] on 20 July 2014 in Rosenborg's home game against [[Sogndal Fotball|Sogndal]] coming on as a substitute for [[Alexander Søderlund]] after 60 minutes.{{cite web|url=http://www.aftenbladet.no/100Sport/fotball/eliteserien/Debutant-Sorloth---Jeg-burde-kanskje-hatt-en-scoring-448821_1.snd|title=Debutant Sørloth: – Jeg burde kanskje hatt en scoring|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2018|subscription=y|language=no}} Sørloth went on a loan to [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]] before the start of the 2015 [[Tippeligaen]]. He quickly became one of the best players in the team and one of the best players in the league scoring 13 goals and making 5 assist in his 26 appearances (19 starters), including scoring six goals in one game against [[Sarpsborg 08 FF|Sarpsborg 08]]. In his last match for [[FK Bodø/Glimt|Bodø/Glimt]], he scored his second hat-trick of the season, against Stabæk. ===Groningen=== On 6 November 2015, Sørloth confirmed that he would be joining [[FC Groningen]] on a 4.5-year contract at the end of the season. [[FC Groningen]] paid a transfer fee of around €750,000. ===Midtjylland=== On 1 June 2017, [[FC Midtjylland]] announced that they had signed a four-year contract with Alexander Sørloth.{{cite web|url=https://www.fcm.dk/nyheder/fcm-tv/--vi-faar-endnu-en-klasseangriber|title=- Vi får endnu en klasseangriber|website=www.fcm.dk|accessdate=1 February 2018}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 31 January 2018, Sørloth signed for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] for a reported fee of £9 million.{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/february/sorloth-is-new-eagles-number-nine/|title=Crystal Palace FC Sørloth Is New Eagles Number Nine|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2018}} He made his debut on 10 February 2018 in a 3–1 defeat to Everton.{{cite web |title=Sørloth Not Satisfied After Debut |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/february/sorloth-not-satisfied-after-debut/ |website=cpfc.co.uk |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |accessdate=3 June 2018 |date=10 February 2018}} On Tuesday 28 August, Sørloth scored his first goal for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in a Carabao Cup game against Swansea City with the game finishing 1–0.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/08/28/alexander-sorloth-fires-first-crystal-palace-goal-see-swansea/|title=Alexander Sorloth fires first Crystal Palace goal to see off Swansea in Carabao Cup|accessdate=1 December 2018}} ===K.A.A. Gent=== On 8 January 2019, Sørloth signed for [[Belgian First Division A]] side, [[K. A. A. Gent|Gent]] on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season.{{cite web|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2019/january/alexander-sorloth-to-join-kaa-gent-for-a-season-long-loan/|title=Alexander Sørloth Joins KAA Gent on Loan|website=cpfc.co.uk|date=8 January 2018|accessdate=8 January 2019}} ==Personal life== He is the son of former Rosenborg player and Norwegian international [[Gøran Sørloth]]. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|12 March 2019}}{{nifs|95429|accessdate=8 March 2014}}{{soccerway|alexander-sorloth/218038}}{{cite web|title=Alexander Sørloth » Club {{Infobox football biography | name = Jason Lokilo | fullname = Jason Eyenga Lokilo{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=24 March 2018}} | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1998|9|17}}{{cite web |title=Jason Eyenga-Lokilo |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/jason-eyenga-lokilo-256056/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=22 August 2017}} | birth_place = [[Brussels]], Belgium | height = 1.75m | position = [[Midfielder (association football)#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) | clubnumber = 21https://m.lfp.fr/joueur/eyenga-lokilo-jason | youthclubs1 = [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] | youthyears1 = 2007–2014 | youthclubs2 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | youthyears2 = 2015–2017 | clubs1 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | years1 = 2017– | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] (loan) | caps2 = 4 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2015 | nationalteam1 = [[DR Congo national under-20 football team|DR Congo U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 21:47, 22 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 5 March 2017 }} '''Jason Eyenga Lokilo''' (born 17 September 1998) is a Congolese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Ligue 2]] side [[FC Lorient]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. ==Early life== Lokilo was born in [[Brussels]], Belgium on 17 September 1998. ==Playing career== Lokilo was a member of the [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] academy between 2007 and 2014.{{cite news|title=Securing investments in youth training: the Lokilo case|url=http://crestafirm.com/2017/07/11/securing-investments-youth-training-lokilo-case/|accessdate=23 August 2017|work=Football Legal}} He signed for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 29 July 2015,{{cite news|title=Crystal Palace sign Belgian teen star Jason Lokilo from Anderlecht|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3254965/Crystal-Palace-sign-Belgian-teen-star-Jason-Lokilo-Anderlecht.html|accessdate=23 August 2017|publisher=Daily Mail}} spending the following two seasons playing for their youth teams. Following a number of appearances for the first team in pre-season games, Lokilo made his senior debut for Crystal Palace on 22 August 2017 against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]].{{cite news|title=James McArthur brace hands Frank de Boer first Eagles win|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/crystal-palace-2-ipswich-town-1-james-mcarthur-brace-hands-frank-de-boer-first-eagles-win-a3617751.html|accessdate=23 August 2017|work=Evening Standard}} In August 2018, he joined French club [[FC Lorient]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/lokilo-joins-lorient-on-loan/|title=Lokilo Joins Lorient on Loan|access-date=2018-09-19|language=en-gb}} ==International career== Lokilo was born in Belgium and is of Congolese descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.adiac-congo.com/content/football-des-jeunes-la-rdc-u20-joue-en-amical-contre-langleterre-junior-39481|title=Football des jeunes : la RDC U20 joue en amical contre l’Angleterre junior - adiac-congo.com : toute l'actualité du Bassin du Congo|website=www.adiac-congo.com}} Lokilo debuted for the [[DR Congo national under-20 football team|DR Congo U20]] in an 8–0 friendly loss to the [[England national under-17 football team|England U17s]] on 7 October 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2015/oct/07/england-u17s-v-congo-dr-st-georges-park-match-report-071015|title=England U17s hit eight in World Cup warm-up with DR Congo|first=The Football|last=Association|website=www.thefa.com}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 15 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, '''James Daly''' may refer to:

==See also== *[[James Daley (disambiguation)]] *[[Jim Daly (disambiguation)]] *[[Jimmy Daly]] (born 1905), former Irish footballer *[[Jimmy Dailey]] (1927–2002), Scottish footballer

{{Infobox football biography |name = Nya Kirby |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Nya Jerome Kirby{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/1034294|title=Updated squad lists for 2018/19 Premier League |publisher=Premier League |date=1 February 2019 |accessdate=1 February 2019}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|2000|1|31|df=y}}{{soccerway|nya-kirby/478365/|accessdate=11 January 2019}} |birth_place = [[Islington]], England |height = 1.73m{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/nya-kirby-255722/ |title=Nya Kirby|website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=2 February 2019}} |position = [[Midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) |clubnumber = 23 |youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2017 |youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] |youthyears2 = 2017–2018 |youthclubs2 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] |years1 = 2018– |clubs1 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2019– |clubs2 = → [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] (loan) |caps2 = 4 |goals2 = 0 |nationalyears1 = |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps1 = |nationalgoals1 = |nationalyears2 = |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps2 = |nationalgoals2 = |club-update = 18:47, 16 March 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 14:46, 11 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Nya Jerome Kirby''' (born 31 January 2000) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]], on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], as a [[midfielder]]. ==Career== Kirby played youth football for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], before moving on loan to [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] in January 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46840867|title=Nya Kirby: Crystal Palace midfielder joins Blackpool on loan|date=11 January 2019|accessdate=11 January 2019|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his debut for Blackpool on 29 January 2019, coming off the bench in a 2–2 draw with [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] and winning the 85th minute [[penalty kick|penalty]] which [[Harry Pritchard (footballer)|Harry Pritchard]] scored to earn a point.{{cite web|url=https://www.blackpoolgazette.co.uk/sport/football/blackpool-fc/terry-mcphillips-explains-why-nya-kirby-wasn-t-allowed-to-take-blackpool-s-late-penalty-in-wycombe-draw-1-9565187|title=Terry McPhillips explains why Nya Kirby wasn't allowed to take Blackpool's late penalty in Wycombe draw|date=30 January 2019|accessdate=30 January 2019|author=Matt Scrafton|publisher=Blackpool Gazette}} He has represented England at under-17 and under-19 international youth levels. He won the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46800068|title=England's U17 World Cup winners - where are they now?|date=17 January 2019|accessdate=17 January 2019|author=Shamoon Hafez|publisher=BBC Sport}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Blackpool F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kirby, Nya}} [[Category:2000 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:People from the London Borough of Islington]] [[Category:Tottenham Hotspur F.C. players]] [[Category:Crystal Palace F.C. players]] [[Category:Blackpool F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] {{England-footy-bio-stub}}
